All Fqsen (for search Ctrl+F) frame | noframe

namespace Doctrine\

namespace Doctrine\Common\

namespace Doctrine\Common\Cache\

class Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider

Base class for cache provider implementations.

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::DOCTRINE_NAMESPACE_CACHEKEY

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::STATS_HITS

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::STATS_MISSES

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::STATS_UPTIME

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::STATS_MEMORY_USAGE

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::STATS_MEMORY_AVAILABLE

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::STATS_MEMORY_AVAILIABLE

Only for backward compatibility (may be removed in next major release)

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::setNamespace()

Sets the namespace to prefix all cache ids with.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::getNamespace()

Retrieves the namespace that prefixes all cache ids.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::fetch()

Fetches an entry from the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::fetchMultiple()

Returns an associative array of values for keys is found in cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::saveMultiple()

Returns a boolean value indicating if the operation succeeded.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::contains()

Tests if an entry exists in the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::save()

Puts data into the cache.

If a cache entry with the given id already exists, its data will be replaced.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::deleteMultiple()

Deletes several cache entries.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::delete()

Deletes a cache entry.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::getStats()

Retrieves cached information from the data store.

The server's statistics array has the following values:

  • hits
    Number of keys that have been requested and found present.

  • misses
    Number of items that have been requested and not found.

  • uptime
    Time that the server is running.

  • memory_usage
    Memory used by this server to store items.

  • memory_available
    Memory allowed to use for storage.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::flushAll()

Flushes all cache entries, globally.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::deleteAll()

Deletes all cache entries in the current cache namespace.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doFetchMultiple()

Default implementation of doFetchMultiple. Each driver that supports multi-get should owerwrite it.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doFetch()

Fetches an entry from the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doContains()

Tests if an entry exists in the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doSaveMultiple()

Default implementation of doSaveMultiple. Each driver that supports multi-put should override it.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doSave()

Puts data into the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doDeleteMultiple()

Default implementation of doDeleteMultiple. Each driver that supports multi-delete should override it.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doDelete()

Deletes a cache entry.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doFlush()

Flushes all cache entries.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\CacheProvider::doGetStats()

Retrieves cached information from the data store.

class Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache

Array cache driver.

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::DOCTRINE_NAMESPACE_CACHEKEY

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::STATS_MEMORY_AVAILIABLE

Only for backward compatibility (may be removed in next major release)

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doFetch()

Fetches an entry from the cache.

Tests if an entry exists in the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doSave()

Puts data into the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doDelete()

Deletes a cache entry.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doFlush()

Flushes all cache entries.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doGetStats()

Retrieves cached information from the data store.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::setNamespace()

Sets the namespace to prefix all cache ids with.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::getNamespace()

Retrieves the namespace that prefixes all cache ids.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::fetch()

Fetches an entry from the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::fetchMultiple()

Returns an associative array of values for keys is found in cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::saveMultiple()

Returns a boolean value indicating if the operation succeeded.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::contains()

Tests if an entry exists in the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::save()

Puts data into the cache.

If a cache entry with the given id already exists, its data will be replaced.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::deleteMultiple()

Deletes several cache entries.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::delete()

Deletes a cache entry.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::getStats()

Retrieves cached information from the data store.

The server's statistics array has the following values:

  • hits
    Number of keys that have been requested and found present.

  • misses
    Number of items that have been requested and not found.

  • uptime
    Time that the server is running.

  • memory_usage
    Memory used by this server to store items.

  • memory_available
    Memory allowed to use for storage.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::flushAll()

Flushes all cache entries, globally.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::deleteAll()

Deletes all cache entries in the current cache namespace.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doFetchMultiple()

Default implementation of doFetchMultiple. Each driver that supports multi-get should owerwrite it.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doSaveMultiple()

Default implementation of doSaveMultiple. Each driver that supports multi-put should override it.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ArrayCache::doDeleteMultiple()

Default implementation of doDeleteMultiple. Each driver that supports multi-delete should override it.

interface Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache

Interface for cache drivers.

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::STATS_HITS

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::STATS_MISSES

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::STATS_UPTIME

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::STATS_MEMORY_USAGE

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::STATS_MEMORY_AVAILABLE

classconstant Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::STATS_MEMORY_AVAILIABLE

Only for backward compatibility (may be removed in next major release)

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::fetch()

Fetches an entry from the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::contains()

Tests if an entry exists in the cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::save()

Puts data into the cache.

If a cache entry with the given id already exists, its data will be replaced.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::delete()

Deletes a cache entry.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache::getStats()

Retrieves cached information from the data store.

The server's statistics array has the following values:

  • hits
    Number of keys that have been requested and found present.

  • misses
    Number of items that have been requested and not found.

  • uptime
    Time that the server is running.

  • memory_usage
    Memory used by this server to store items.

  • memory_available
    Memory allowed to use for storage.

interface Doctrine\Common\Cache\FlushableCache

Interface for cache that can be flushed.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\FlushableCache::flushAll()

Flushes all cache entries, globally.

interface Doctrine\Common\Cache\ClearableCache

Interface for cache that can be flushed.

Intended to be used for partial clearing of a cache namespace. For a more
global "flushing", see Doctrine\Common\Cache\FlushableCache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\ClearableCache::deleteAll()

Deletes all cache entries in the current cache namespace.

interface Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiOperationCache

Interface for cache drivers that supports multiple items manipulation.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiOperationCache::fetchMultiple()

Returns an associative array of values for keys is found in cache.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiOperationCache::deleteMultiple()

Deletes several cache entries.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiOperationCache::saveMultiple()

Returns a boolean value indicating if the operation succeeded.

interface Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiGetCache

Interface for cache drivers that allows to get many items at once.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiGetCache::fetchMultiple()

Returns an associative array of values for keys is found in cache.

interface Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiDeleteCache

Interface for cache drivers that allows to put many items at once.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiDeleteCache::deleteMultiple()

Deletes several cache entries.

interface Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiPutCache

Interface for cache drivers that allows to put many items at once.

method Doctrine\Common\Cache\MultiPutCache::saveMultiple()

Returns a boolean value indicating if the operation succeeded.

class Doctrine\Common\EventManager

The EventManager is the central point of Doctrine's event listener system.
Listeners are registered on the manager and events are dispatched through the
manager.

method Doctrine\Common\EventManager::dispatchEvent()

Dispatches an event to all registered listeners.

method Doctrine\Common\EventManager::getListeners()

Gets the listeners of a specific event or all listeners.

method Doctrine\Common\EventManager::hasListeners()

Checks whether an event has any registered listeners.

method Doctrine\Common\EventManager::addEventListener()

Adds an event listener that listens on the specified events.

method Doctrine\Common\EventManager::removeEventListener()

Removes an event listener from the specified events.

method Doctrine\Common\EventManager::addEventSubscriber()

Adds an EventSubscriber. The subscriber is asked for all the events it is
interested in and added as a listener for these events.

method Doctrine\Common\EventManager::removeEventSubscriber()

Removes an EventSubscriber. The subscriber is asked for all the events it is
interested in and removed as a listener for these events.

class Doctrine\Common\EventArgs

EventArgs is the base class for classes containing event data.

This class contains no event data. It is used by events that do not pass state
information to an event handler when an event is raised. The single empty EventArgs
instance can be obtained through getEmptyInstance.

method Doctrine\Common\EventArgs::getEmptyInstance()

Gets the single, empty and immutable EventArgs instance.

This instance will be used when events are dispatched without any parameter,
like this: EventManager::dispatchEvent('eventname');

The benefit from this is that only one empty instance is instantiated and shared
(otherwise there would be instances for every dispatched in the abovementioned form).

interface Doctrine\Common\EventSubscriber

An EventSubscriber knows himself what events he is interested in.
If an EventSubscriber is added to an EventManager, the manager invokes
getSubscribedEvents and registers the subscriber as a listener for all
returned events.

method Doctrine\Common\EventSubscriber::getSubscribedEvents()

Returns an array of events this subscriber wants to listen to.

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::closeCursor()

Closes the cursor, enabling the statement to be executed again.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::columnCount()

Returns the number of columns in the result set

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::setFetchMode()

Sets the fetch mode to use while iterating this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::getIterator()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::fetch()

Returns the next row of a result set.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::fetchAll()

Returns an array containing all of the result set rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ArrayStatement::fetchColumn()

Returns a single column from the next row of a result set or FALSE if there are no more rows.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile

Query Cache Profile handles the data relevant for query caching.

It is a value object, setter methods return NEW instances.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::getResultCacheDriver()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::getLifetime()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::getCacheKey()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::generateCacheKeys()

Generates the real cache key from query, params, types and connection parameters.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::setResultCacheDriver()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::setCacheKey()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\QueryCacheProfile::setLifetime()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement

Cache statement for SQL results.

A result is saved in multiple cache keys, there is the originally specified
cache key which is just pointing to result rows by key. The following things
have to be ensured:

  1. lifetime of the original key has to be longer than that of all the individual rows keys
  2. if any one row key is missing the query has to be re-executed.

Also you have to realize that the cache will load the whole result into memory at once to ensure 2.
This means that the memory usage for cached results might increase by using this feature.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::closeCursor()

Closes the cursor, enabling the statement to be executed again.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::columnCount()

Returns the number of columns in the result set

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::setFetchMode()

Sets the fetch mode to use while iterating this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::getIterator()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::fetch()

Returns the next row of a result set.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::fetchAll()

Returns an array containing all of the result set rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::fetchColumn()

Returns a single column from the next row of a result set or FALSE if there are no more rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Cache\ResultCacheStatement::rowCount()

Returns the number of rows affected by the last DELETE, INSERT, or UPDATE statement
executed by the corresponding object.

If the last SQL statement executed by the associated Statement object was a SELECT statement,
some databases may return the number of rows returned by that statement. However,
this behaviour is not guaranteed for all databases and should not be
relied on for portable applications.

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\AbstractOracleDriver\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\AbstractOracleDriver\EasyConnectString

Represents an Oracle Easy Connect string

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\AbstractOracleDriver\EasyConnectString::__toString()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\AbstractOracleDriver\EasyConnectString::fromArray()

Creates the object from an array representation

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\AbstractOracleDriver\EasyConnectString::fromConnectionParameters()

Creates the object from the given DBAL connection parameters.

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver

Drizzle driver using PDO MySql.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::connect()

Attempts to create a connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::createDatabasePlatformForVersion()

Factory method for creating the appropriate platform instance for the given version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::getDatabasePlatform()

Gets the DatabasePlatform instance that provides all the metadata about
the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::getSchemaManager()

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect and change the underlying
database schema of the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::getName()

Gets the name of the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::constructPdoDsn()

Constructs the MySql PDO DSN.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::convertException()

Converts a given DBAL driver exception into a standardized DBAL driver exception.

It evaluates the vendor specific error code and SQLSTATE and transforms
it into a unified Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException subclass.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DrizzlePDOMySql\Driver::getDatabase()

Gets the name of the database connected to for this driver.

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver

PDO Oracle driver.

WARNING: This driver gives us segfaults in our testsuites on CLOB and other
stuff. PDO Oracle is not maintained by Oracle or anyone in the PHP community,
which leads us to the recommendation to use the "oci8" driver to connect
to Oracle instead.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver::connect()

Attempts to create a connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver::getName()

Gets the name of the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver::convertException()

Converts a given DBAL driver exception into a standardized DBAL driver exception.

It evaluates the vendor specific error code and SQLSTATE and transforms
it into a unified Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException subclass.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver::getDatabase()

Gets the name of the database connected to for this driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver::getDatabasePlatform()

Gets the DatabasePlatform instance that provides all the metadata about
the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver::getSchemaManager()

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect and change the underlying
database schema of the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOOracle\Driver::getEasyConnectString()

Returns an appropriate Easy Connect String for the given parameters.

Attempts to create a connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\SQLAnywhere\Driver::getName()

Gets the name of the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\SQLAnywhere\Driver::convertException()

Converts a given DBAL driver exception into a standardized DBAL driver exception.

It evaluates the vendor specific error code and SQLSTATE and transforms
it into a unified Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException subclass.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\SQLAnywhere\Driver::createDatabasePlatformForVersion()

Factory method for creating the appropriate platform instance for the given version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\SQLAnywhere\Driver::getDatabase()

Gets the name of the database connected to for this driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\SQLAnywhere\Driver::getDatabasePlatform()

Gets the DatabasePlatform instance that provides all the metadata about
the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\SQLAnywhere\Driver::getSchemaManager()

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect and change the underlying
database schema of the platform this driver connects to.

it into a unified Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException subclass.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::exec()

Executes an SQL statement and return the number of affected rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::getServerVersion()

Returns the version number of the database server connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::prepare()

Prepares a statement for execution and returns a Statement object.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::query()

Executes an SQL statement, returning a result set as a Statement object.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::quote()

Quotes a string for use in a query.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::lastInsertId()

Returns the ID of the last inserted row or sequence value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::requiresQueryForServerVersion()

Checks whether a query is required to retrieve the database server version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::beginTransaction()

Initiates a transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::commit()

Commits a transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::rollBack()

Rolls back the current transaction, as initiated by beginTransaction().

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::inTransaction()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::setAttribute()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::errorCode()

Returns the error code associated with the last operation on the database handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::errorInfo()

Returns extended error information associated with the last operation on the database handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::getAttribute()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::__wakeup()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::__sleep()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOConnection::getAvailableDrivers()

it into a unified Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException subclass.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement

The PDO implementation of the Statement interface.
Used by all PDO-based drivers.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::$queryString

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::__construct()

Protected constructor.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::setFetchMode()

Sets the fetch mode to use while iterating this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::bindValue()

Binds a value to a corresponding named (not supported by mysqli driver, see comment below) or positional
placeholder in the SQL statement that was used to prepare the statement.

As mentioned above, the named parameters are not natively supported by the mysqli driver, use executeQuery(),
fetchAll(), fetchArray(), fetchColumn(), fetchAssoc() methods to have the named parameter emulated by doctrine.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::bindParam()

Binds a PHP variable to a corresponding named (not supported by mysqli driver, see comment below) or question
mark placeholder in the SQL statement that was use to prepare the statement. Unlike PDOStatement->bindValue(),
the variable is bound as a reference and will only be evaluated at the time
that PDOStatement->execute() is called.

As mentioned above, the named parameters are not natively supported by the mysqli driver, use executeQuery(),
fetchAll(), fetchArray(), fetchColumn(), fetchAssoc() methods to have the named parameter emulated by doctrine.

Most parameters are input parameters, that is, parameters that are
used in a read-only fashion to build up the query. Some drivers support the invocation
of stored procedures that return data as output parameters, and some also as input/output
parameters that both send in data and are updated to receive it.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::closeCursor()

Closes the cursor, enabling the statement to be executed again.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::execute()

Executes a prepared statement

If the prepared statement included parameter markers, you must either:
call PDOStatement->bindParam() to bind PHP variables to the parameter markers:
bound variables pass their value as input and receive the output value,
if any, of their associated parameter markers or pass an array of input-only
parameter values.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::fetch()

Returns the next row of a result set.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::fetchAll()

Returns an array containing all of the result set rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::fetchColumn()

Returns a single column from the next row of a result set or FALSE if there are no more rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::bindColumn()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::rowCount()

Returns the number of rows affected by the last DELETE, INSERT, or UPDATE statement
executed by the corresponding object.

If the last SQL statement executed by the associated Statement object was a SELECT statement,
some databases may return the number of rows returned by that statement. However,
this behaviour is not guaranteed for all databases and should not be
relied on for portable applications.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::fetchObject()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::errorCode()

Fetches the SQLSTATE associated with the last operation on the statement handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::errorInfo()

Fetches extended error information associated with the last operation on the statement handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::setAttribute()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::getAttribute()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::columnCount()

Returns the number of columns in the result set

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::getColumnMeta()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::nextRowset()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::debugDumpParams()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::__wakeup()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOStatement::__sleep()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException

Tiny wrapper for PDOException instances to implement the Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException interface.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::$message

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::$code

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::$file

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::$line

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::$errorInfo

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getErrorCode()

Returns the driver specific error code if available.

Returns null if no driver specific error code is available
for the error raised by the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getSQLState()

Returns the SQLSTATE the driver was in at the time the error occurred.

Returns null if the driver does not provide a SQLSTATE for the error occurred.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::__wakeup()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getMessage()

Returns the driver error message.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getCode()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getFile()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getLine()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getTrace()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getPrevious()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::getTraceAsString()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PDOException::__toString()

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection

Connection interface.
Driver connections must implement this interface.

This resembles (a subset of) the PDO interface.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::prepare()

Prepares a statement for execution and returns a Statement object.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::query()

Executes an SQL statement, returning a result set as a Statement object.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::quote()

Quotes a string for use in a query.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::exec()

Executes an SQL statement and return the number of affected rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::lastInsertId()

Returns the ID of the last inserted row or sequence value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::beginTransaction()

Initiates a transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::commit()

Commits a transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::rollBack()

Rolls back the current transaction, as initiated by beginTransaction().

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::errorCode()

Returns the error code associated with the last operation on the database handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection::errorInfo()

Returns extended error information associated with the last operation on the database handle.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ResultStatement

Interface for the reading part of a prepare statement only.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ResultStatement::closeCursor()

Closes the cursor, enabling the statement to be executed again.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ResultStatement::columnCount()

Returns the number of columns in the result set

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ResultStatement::setFetchMode()

Sets the fetch mode to use while iterating this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ResultStatement::fetch()

Returns the next row of a result set.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ResultStatement::fetchAll()

Returns an array containing all of the result set rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ResultStatement::fetchColumn()

Returns a single column from the next row of a result set or FALSE if there are no more rows.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException

Contract for a driver exception.

Driver exceptions provide the SQLSTATE of the driver
and the driver specific error code at the time the error occurred.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getErrorCode()

Returns the driver specific error code if available.

Returns null if no driver specific error code is available
for the error raised by the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getMessage()

Returns the driver error message.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getSQLState()

Returns the SQLSTATE the driver was in at the time the error occurred.

Returns null if the driver does not provide a SQLSTATE for the error occurred.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getCode()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getFile()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getLine()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getTrace()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getPrevious()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::getTraceAsString()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\DriverException::__toString()

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ExceptionConverterDriver

Contract for a driver that is capable of converting DBAL driver exceptions into standardized DBAL driver exceptions.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ExceptionConverterDriver::convertException()

Converts a given DBAL driver exception into a standardized DBAL driver exception.

It evaluates the vendor specific error code and SQLSTATE and transforms
it into a unified Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException subclass.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement

Statement interface.
Drivers must implement this interface.

This resembles (a subset of) the PDOStatement interface.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::bindValue()

Binds a value to a corresponding named (not supported by mysqli driver, see comment below) or positional
placeholder in the SQL statement that was used to prepare the statement.

As mentioned above, the named parameters are not natively supported by the mysqli driver, use executeQuery(),
fetchAll(), fetchArray(), fetchColumn(), fetchAssoc() methods to have the named parameter emulated by doctrine.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::bindParam()

Binds a PHP variable to a corresponding named (not supported by mysqli driver, see comment below) or question
mark placeholder in the SQL statement that was use to prepare the statement. Unlike PDOStatement->bindValue(),
the variable is bound as a reference and will only be evaluated at the time
that PDOStatement->execute() is called.

As mentioned above, the named parameters are not natively supported by the mysqli driver, use executeQuery(),
fetchAll(), fetchArray(), fetchColumn(), fetchAssoc() methods to have the named parameter emulated by doctrine.

Most parameters are input parameters, that is, parameters that are
used in a read-only fashion to build up the query. Some drivers support the invocation
of stored procedures that return data as output parameters, and some also as input/output
parameters that both send in data and are updated to receive it.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::errorCode()

Fetches the SQLSTATE associated with the last operation on the statement handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::errorInfo()

Fetches extended error information associated with the last operation on the statement handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::execute()

Executes a prepared statement

If the prepared statement included parameter markers, you must either:
call PDOStatement->bindParam() to bind PHP variables to the parameter markers:
bound variables pass their value as input and receive the output value,
if any, of their associated parameter markers or pass an array of input-only
parameter values.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::rowCount()

Returns the number of rows affected by the last DELETE, INSERT, or UPDATE statement
executed by the corresponding object.

If the last SQL statement executed by the associated Statement object was a SELECT statement,
some databases may return the number of rows returned by that statement. However,
this behaviour is not guaranteed for all databases and should not be
relied on for portable applications.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::closeCursor()

Closes the cursor, enabling the statement to be executed again.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::columnCount()

Returns the number of columns in the result set

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::setFetchMode()

Sets the fetch mode to use while iterating this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::fetch()

Returns the next row of a result set.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::fetchAll()

Returns an array containing all of the result set rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::fetchColumn()

Returns a single column from the next row of a result set or FALSE if there are no more rows.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PingableConnection

An interface for connections which support a "native" ping method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\PingableConnection::ping()

Pings the database server to determine if the connection is still
available. Return true/false based on if that was successful or not.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ServerInfoAwareConnection

Contract for a connection that is able to provide information about the server it is connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ServerInfoAwareConnection::getServerVersion()

Returns the version number of the database server connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\ServerInfoAwareConnection::requiresQueryForServerVersion()

Checks whether a query is required to retrieve the database server version.

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Event\

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Event\Listeners\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Event\Listeners\SQLSessionInit

Session init listener for executing a single SQL statement right after a connection is opened.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Event\Listeners\SQLSessionInit::$sql

method Doctrine\DBAL\Event\Listeners\SQLSessionInit::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Event\Listeners\SQLSessionInit::postConnect()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Event\Listeners\SQLSessionInit::getSubscribedEvents()

Returns an array of events this subscriber wants to listen to.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Event\SchemaEventArgs

Base class for schema related events.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Event\SchemaEventArgs::preventDefault()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Event\SchemaEventArgs::isDefaultPrevented()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Event\SchemaEventArgs::getEmptyInstance()

Gets the single, empty and immutable EventArgs instance.

This instance will be used when events are dispatched without any parameter,
like this: EventManager::dispatchEvent('eventname');

The benefit from this is that only one empty instance is instantiated and shared
(otherwise there would be instances for every dispatched in the abovementioned form).

class Doctrine\DBAL\Event\SchemaAlterTableAddColumnEventArgs

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException

Base class for all errors detected in the driver.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::$message

property Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::$code

property Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::$file

property Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::$line

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getErrorCode()

Returns the driver specific error code if given.

Returns null if no error code was given by the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getSQLState()

Returns the SQLSTATE the driver was in at the time the error occurred, if given.

Returns null if no SQLSTATE was given by the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::notSupported()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::invalidPlatformSpecified()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::invalidPlatformType()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::invalidPlatformVersionSpecified()

Returns a new instance for an invalid specified platform version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::invalidPdoInstance()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::driverRequired()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::unknownDriver()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::driverExceptionDuringQuery()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::driverException()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::invalidWrapperClass()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::invalidDriverClass()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::invalidTableName()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::noColumnsSpecifiedForTable()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::limitOffsetInvalid()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::typeExists()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::unknownColumnType()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::typeNotFound()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::__wakeup()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getMessage()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getCode()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getFile()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getLine()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getTrace()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getPrevious()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::getTraceAsString()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception\DriverException::__toString()

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\LoggerChain

Chains multiple SQLLogger.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\LoggerChain::addLogger()

Adds a logger in the chain.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\LoggerChain::startQuery()

Logs a SQL statement somewhere.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\LoggerChain::stopQuery()

Marks the last started query as stopped. This can be used for timing of queries.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\SQLLogger

Interface for SQL loggers.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\SQLLogger::startQuery()

Logs a SQL statement somewhere.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\SQLLogger::stopQuery()

Marks the last started query as stopped. This can be used for timing of queries.

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\Keywords\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\Keywords\KeywordList

Abstract interface for a SQL reserved keyword dictionary.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\Keywords\KeywordList::isKeyword()

Checks if the given word is a keyword of this dialect/vendor platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\Keywords\KeywordList::initializeKeywords()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\Keywords\KeywordList::getKeywords()

Returns the list of keywords.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\Keywords\KeywordList::getName()

Returns the name of this keyword list.
