method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getWildcards()

Gets all SQL wildcard characters of the platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getAvgExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the average value of a column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getCountExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the number of rows (without a NULL value) of a column.

If a '*' is used instead of a column the number of selected rows is returned.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getMaxExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the highest value of a column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getMinExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the lowest value of a column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getSumExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the total sum of a column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getLengthExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the length of a text field.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getSqrtExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the squared value of a column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getRoundExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to round a numeric field to the number of decimals specified.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getModExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the remainder of the division operation $expression1 / $expression2.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getRtrimExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to trim trailing space characters from the expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getLtrimExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to trim leading space characters from the expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getUpperExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to change all characters from the expression to uppercase,
according to the current character set mapping.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getLowerExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to change all characters from the expression to lowercase,
according to the current character set mapping.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getNowExpression()

Returns the SQL snippet to get the current system date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getNotExpression()

Returns the SQL for a logical not.

Example:

$q = new Doctrine_Query();
$e = $q->expr;
$q->select('*')->from('table')
->where($e->eq('id', $e->not('null'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getIsNullExpression()

Returns the SQL that checks if an expression is null.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getIsNotNullExpression()

Returns the SQL that checks if an expression is not null.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getBetweenExpression()

Returns the SQL that checks if an expression evaluates to a value between two values.

The parameter $expression is checked if it is between $value1 and $value2.

Note: There is a slight difference in the way BETWEEN works on some databases.
http://www.w3schools.com/sql/sql_between.asp. If you want complete database
independence you should avoid using between().

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getAcosExpression()

Returns the SQL to get the arccosine of a value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getSinExpression()

Returns the SQL to get the sine of a value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getPiExpression()

Returns the SQL to get the PI value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getCosExpression()

Returns the SQL to get the cosine of a value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddSecondsExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given seconds to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubSecondsExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given seconds from a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddMinutesExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given minutes to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubMinutesExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given minutes from a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddHourExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given hours to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubHourExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given hours to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddDaysExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given days to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubDaysExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given days to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddWeeksExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given weeks to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubWeeksExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given weeks from a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddMonthExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given months to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubMonthExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given months to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddQuartersExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given quarters to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubQuartersExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given quarters from a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateAddYearsExpression()

Returns the SQL to add the number of given years to a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateSubYearsExpression()

Returns the SQL to subtract the number of given years from a date.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getBitAndComparisonExpression()

Returns the SQL bit AND comparison expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getBitOrComparisonExpression()

Returns the SQL bit OR comparison expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getReadLockSQL()

Returns the SQL snippet to append to any SELECT statement which locks rows in shared read lock.

This defaults to the ANSI SQL "FOR UPDATE", which is an exclusive lock (Write). Some database
vendors allow to lighten this constraint up to be a real read lock.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getWriteLockSQL()

Returns the SQL snippet to append to any SELECT statement which obtains an exclusive lock on the rows.

The semantics of this lock mode should equal the SELECT .. FOR UPDATE of the ANSI SQL standard.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDropTableSQL()

Returns the SQL snippet to drop an existing table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDropTemporaryTableSQL()

Returns the SQL to safely drop a temporary table WITHOUT implicitly committing an open transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDropConstraintSQL()

Returns the SQL to drop a constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDropForeignKeySQL()

Returns the SQL to drop a foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getCreateTableSQL()

Returns the SQL statement(s) to create a table with the specified name, columns and constraints
on this platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getInlineColumnCommentSQL()

Returns the SQL to create inline comment on a column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getPartialIndexSQL()

Adds condition for partial index.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getCreateSchemaSQL()

Returns the SQL to create a named schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::quoteIdentifier()

Quotes a string so that it can be safely used as a table or column name,
even if it is a reserved word of the platform. This also detects identifier
chains separated by dot and quotes them independently.

NOTE: Just because you CAN use quoted identifiers doesn't mean
you SHOULD use them. In general, they end up causing way more
problems than they solve.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::quoteSingleIdentifier()

Quotes a single identifier (no dot chain separation).

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getCreateForeignKeySQL()

Returns the SQL to create a new foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::onSchemaAlterTableAddColumn()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::onSchemaAlterTableRemoveColumn()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::onSchemaAlterTableChangeColumn()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::onSchemaAlterTableRenameColumn()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::onSchemaAlterTable()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getPreAlterTableIndexForeignKeySQL()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getPostAlterTableIndexForeignKeySQL()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::_getAlterTableIndexForeignKeySQL()

Common code for alter table statement generation that updates the changed Index and Foreign Key definitions.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getColumnDeclarationListSQL()

Gets declaration of a number of fields in bulk.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getColumnDeclarationSQL()

Obtains DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to declare a generic type
field to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDecimalTypeDeclarationSQL()

Returns the SQL snippet that declares a floating point column of arbitrary precision.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDefaultValueDeclarationSQL()

Obtains DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to set a default value
declaration to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getCheckDeclarationSQL()

Obtains DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to set a CHECK constraint
declaration to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getCustomTypeDeclarationSQL()

Obtains SQL code portion needed to create a custom column,
e.g. when a field has the "columnDefinition" keyword.
Only "AUTOINCREMENT" and "PRIMARY KEY" are added if appropriate.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getIndexFieldDeclarationListSQL()

Obtains DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to set an index
declaration to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getTemporaryTableName()

Some vendors require temporary table names to be qualified specially.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getForeignKeyDeclarationSQL()

Obtain DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to set the FOREIGN KEY constraint
of a field declaration to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getUniqueFieldDeclarationSQL()

Obtains DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to set the UNIQUE constraint
of a field declaration to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getColumnCharsetDeclarationSQL()

Obtains DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to set the CHARACTER SET
of a field declaration to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getColumnCollationDeclarationSQL()

Obtains DBMS specific SQL code portion needed to set the COLLATION
of a field declaration to be used in statements like CREATE TABLE.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::prefersSequences()

Whether the platform prefers sequences for ID generation.
Subclasses should override this method to return TRUE if they prefer sequences.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::convertBooleans()

Some platforms need the boolean values to be converted.

The default conversion in this implementation converts to integers (false => 0, true => 1).

Note: if the input is not a boolean the original input might be returned.

There are two contexts when converting booleans: Literals and Prepared Statements.
This method should handle the literal case

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::convertFromBoolean()

Some platforms have boolean literals that needs to be correctly converted

The default conversion tries to convert value into bool "(bool)$item"

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::convertBooleansToDatabaseValue()

This method should handle the prepared statements case. When there is no
distinction, it's OK to use the same method.

Note: if the input is not a boolean the original input might be returned.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getListNamespacesSQL()

Returns the SQL statement for retrieving the namespaces defined in the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getFloatDeclarationSQL()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::usesSequenceEmulatedIdentityColumns()

Whether the platform emulates identity columns through sequences.

Some platforms that do not support identity columns natively
but support sequences can emulate identity columns by using
sequences.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getIdentitySequenceName()

Returns the name of the sequence for a particular identity column in a particular table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsIndexes()

Whether the platform supports indexes.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsPartialIndexes()

Whether the platform supports partial indexes.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsColumnLengthIndexes()

Whether the platform supports indexes with column length definitions.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsAlterTable()

Whether the platform supports altering tables.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsTransactions()

Whether the platform supports transactions.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsSavepoints()

Whether the platform supports savepoints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsReleaseSavepoints()

Whether the platform supports releasing savepoints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsPrimaryConstraints()

Whether the platform supports primary key constraints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsForeignKeyConstraints()

Whether the platform supports foreign key constraints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsForeignKeyOnUpdate()

Whether this platform supports onUpdate in foreign key constraints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsSchemas()

Whether the platform supports database schemas.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::canEmulateSchemas()

Whether this platform can emulate schemas.

Platforms that either support or emulate schemas don't automatically
filter a schema for the namespaced elements in {@link
AbstractManager#createSchema}.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDefaultSchemaName()

Returns the default schema name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsCreateDropDatabase()

Whether this platform supports create database.

Some databases don't allow to create and drop databases at all or only with certain tools.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsGettingAffectedRows()

Whether the platform supports getting the affected rows of a recent update/delete type query.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsInlineColumnComments()

Whether this platform support to add inline column comments as postfix.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::hasNativeJsonType()

Does this platform have native JSON type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getIdentityColumnNullInsertSQL()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsViews()

Whether this platform supports views.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsColumnCollation()

Does this platform support column collation?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDateFormatString()

Gets the format string, as accepted by the date() function, that describes
the format of a stored date value of this platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::modifyLimitQuery()

Adds an driver-specific LIMIT clause to the query.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::supportsLimitOffset()

Whether the database platform support offsets in modify limit clauses.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getSQLResultCasing()

Gets the character casing of a column in an SQL result set of this platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getEmptyIdentityInsertSQL()

Returns the insert SQL for an empty insert statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getDummySelectSQL()

This is for test reasons, many vendors have special requirements for dummy statements.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::createSavePoint()

Returns the SQL to create a new savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::releaseSavePoint()

Returns the SQL to release a savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::rollbackSavePoint()

Returns the SQL to rollback a savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getReservedKeywordsList()

Returns the keyword list instance of this platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::quoteStringLiteral()

Quotes a literal string.
This method is NOT meant to fix SQL injections!
It is only meant to escape this platform's string literal
quote character inside the given literal string.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getStringLiteralQuoteCharacter()

Gets the character used for string literal quoting.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::escapeStringForLike()

Escapes metacharacters in a string intended to be used with a LIKE
operator.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\SQLAnywhere16Platform::getLikeWildcardCharacters()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::SECOND

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::MINUTE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::HOUR

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::DAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::WEEK

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::MONTH

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::QUARTER

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\DateIntervalUnit::YEAR

class Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\TrimMode

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\TrimMode::UNSPECIFIED

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\TrimMode::LEADING

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\TrimMode::TRAILING

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\TrimMode::BOTH

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Query\

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder

ExpressionBuilder class is responsible to dynamically create SQL query parts.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::EQ

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::NEQ

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::LT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::LTE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::GT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::GTE

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::__construct()

Initializes a new ExpressionBuilder.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::andX()

Creates a conjunction of the given boolean expressions.

Example:

[php]
// (u.type = ?) AND (u.role = ?)
$expr->andX('u.type = ?', 'u.role = ?'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::orX()

Creates a disjunction of the given boolean expressions.

Example:

[php]
// (u.type = ?) OR (u.role = ?)
$qb->where($qb->expr()->orX('u.type = ?', 'u.role = ?'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::comparison()

Creates a comparison expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::eq()

Creates an equality comparison expression with the given arguments.

First argument is considered the left expression and the second is the right expression.
When converted to string, it will generated a = . Example:

[php]
// u.id = ?
$expr->eq('u.id', '?');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::neq()

Creates a non equality comparison expression with the given arguments.
First argument is considered the left expression and the second is the right expression.
When converted to string, it will generated a <> . Example:

[php]
// u.id <> 1
$q->where($q->expr()->neq('u.id', '1'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::lt()

Creates a lower-than comparison expression with the given arguments.
First argument is considered the left expression and the second is the right expression.
When converted to string, it will generated a < . Example:

[php]
// u.id < ?
$q->where($q->expr()->lt('u.id', '?'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::lte()

Creates a lower-than-equal comparison expression with the given arguments.
First argument is considered the left expression and the second is the right expression.
When converted to string, it will generated a <= . Example:

[php]
// u.id <= ?
$q->where($q->expr()->lte('u.id', '?'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::gt()

Creates a greater-than comparison expression with the given arguments.
First argument is considered the left expression and the second is the right expression.
When converted to string, it will generated a > . Example:

[php]
// u.id > ?
$q->where($q->expr()->gt('u.id', '?'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::gte()

Creates a greater-than-equal comparison expression with the given arguments.
First argument is considered the left expression and the second is the right expression.
When converted to string, it will generated a >= . Example:

[php]
// u.id >= ?
$q->where($q->expr()->gte('u.id', '?'));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::isNull()

Creates an IS NULL expression with the given arguments.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::isNotNull()

Creates an IS NOT NULL expression with the given arguments.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::like()

Creates a LIKE() comparison expression with the given arguments.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::notLike()

Creates a NOT LIKE() comparison expression with the given arguments.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::in()

Creates a IN () comparison expression with the given arguments.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::notIn()

Creates a NOT IN () comparison expression with the given arguments.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder::literal()

Quotes a given input parameter.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression

Composite expression is responsible to build a group of similar expression.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::TYPE_AND

Constant that represents an AND composite expression.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::TYPE_OR

Constant that represents an OR composite expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::addMultiple()

Adds multiple parts to composite expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::add()

Adds an expression to composite expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::count()

Retrieves the amount of expressions on composite expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::__toString()

Retrieves the string representation of this composite expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\CompositeExpression::getType()

Returns the type of this composite expression (AND/OR).

class Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder

QueryBuilder class is responsible to dynamically create SQL queries.

Important: Verify that every feature you use will work with your database vendor.
SQL Query Builder does not attempt to validate the generated SQL at all.

The query builder does no validation whatsoever if certain features even work with the
underlying database vendor. Limit queries and joins are NOT applied to UPDATE and DELETE statements
even if some vendors such as MySQL support it.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::SELECT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::DELETE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::UPDATE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::INSERT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::STATE_DIRTY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::STATE_CLEAN

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::__construct()

Initializes a new QueryBuilder.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::expr()

Gets an ExpressionBuilder used for object-oriented construction of query expressions.
This producer method is intended for convenient inline usage. Example:

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->where($qb->expr()->eq('u.id', 1));

For more complex expression construction, consider storing the expression
builder object in a local variable.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getType()

Gets the type of the currently built query.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getConnection()

Gets the associated DBAL Connection for this query builder.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getState()

Gets the state of this query builder instance.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::execute()

Executes this query using the bound parameters and their types.

Uses Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeQuery() for select statements and Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeUpdate()
for insert, update and delete statements.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getSQL()

Gets the complete SQL string formed by the current specifications of this QueryBuilder.

$qb = $em->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u')
    ->from('User', 'u')
echo $qb->getSQL(); // SELECT u FROM User u

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::setParameter()

Sets a query parameter for the query being constructed.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->where('u.id = :user_id')
    ->setParameter(':user_id', 1);

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::setParameters()

Sets a collection of query parameters for the query being constructed.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->where('u.id = :user_id1 OR u.id = :user_id2')
    ->setParameters(array(
        ':user_id1' => 1,
        ':user_id2' => 2
    ));

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getParameters()

Gets all defined query parameters for the query being constructed indexed by parameter index or name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getParameter()

Gets a (previously set) query parameter of the query being constructed.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getParameterTypes()

Gets all defined query parameter types for the query being constructed indexed by parameter index or name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getParameterType()

Gets a (previously set) query parameter type of the query being constructed.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::setFirstResult()

Sets the position of the first result to retrieve (the "offset").

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getFirstResult()

Gets the position of the first result the query object was set to retrieve (the "offset").
Returns NULL if setFirstResult was not applied to this QueryBuilder.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::setMaxResults()

Sets the maximum number of results to retrieve (the "limit").

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getMaxResults()

Gets the maximum number of results the query object was set to retrieve (the "limit").
Returns NULL if setMaxResults was not applied to this query builder.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::add()

Either appends to or replaces a single, generic query part.

The available parts are: 'select', 'from', 'set', 'where',
'groupBy', 'having' and 'orderBy'.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::select()

Specifies an item that is to be returned in the query result.
Replaces any previously specified selections, if any.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.id', 'p.id')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->leftJoin('u', 'phonenumbers', 'p', 'u.id = p.user_id');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::addSelect()

Adds an item that is to be returned in the query result.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.id')
    ->addSelect('p.id')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->leftJoin('u', 'phonenumbers', 'u.id = p.user_id');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::delete()

Turns the query being built into a bulk delete query that ranges over
a certain table.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->delete('users', 'u')
    ->where('u.id = :user_id');
    ->setParameter(':user_id', 1);

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::update()

Turns the query being built into a bulk update query that ranges over
a certain table

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->update('counters', 'c')
    ->set('c.value', 'c.value + 1')
    ->where('c.id = ?');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::insert()

Turns the query being built into an insert query that inserts into
a certain table

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->insert('users')
    ->values(
        array(
            'name' => '?',
            'password' => '?'
        )
    );

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::from()

Creates and adds a query root corresponding to the table identified by the
given alias, forming a cartesian product with any existing query roots.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.id')
    ->from('users', 'u')

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::join()

Creates and adds a join to the query.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.name')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->join('u', 'phonenumbers', 'p', 'p.is_primary = 1');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::innerJoin()

Creates and adds a join to the query.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.name')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->innerJoin('u', 'phonenumbers', 'p', 'p.is_primary = 1');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::leftJoin()

Creates and adds a left join to the query.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.name')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->leftJoin('u', 'phonenumbers', 'p', 'p.is_primary = 1');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::rightJoin()

Creates and adds a right join to the query.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.name')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->rightJoin('u', 'phonenumbers', 'p', 'p.is_primary = 1');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::set()

Sets a new value for a column in a bulk update query.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->update('counters', 'c')
    ->set('c.value', 'c.value + 1')
    ->where('c.id = ?');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::where()

Specifies one or more restrictions to the query result.
Replaces any previously specified restrictions, if any.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('c.value')
    ->from('counters', 'c')
    ->where('c.id = ?');

// You can optionally programatically build and/or expressions
$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder();

$or = $qb->expr()->orx();
$or->add($qb->expr()->eq('c.id', 1));
$or->add($qb->expr()->eq('c.id', 2));

$qb->update('counters', 'c')
    ->set('c.value', 'c.value + 1')
    ->where($or);

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::andWhere()

Adds one or more restrictions to the query results, forming a logical
conjunction with any previously specified restrictions.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->where('u.username LIKE ?')
    ->andWhere('u.is_active = 1');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::orWhere()

Adds one or more restrictions to the query results, forming a logical
disjunction with any previously specified restrictions.

$qb = $em->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.name')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->where('u.id = 1')
    ->orWhere('u.id = 2');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::groupBy()

Specifies a grouping over the results of the query.
Replaces any previously specified groupings, if any.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.name')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->groupBy('u.id');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::addGroupBy()

Adds a grouping expression to the query.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->select('u.name')
    ->from('users', 'u')
    ->groupBy('u.lastLogin');
    ->addGroupBy('u.createdAt')

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::setValue()

Sets a value for a column in an insert query.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->insert('users')
    ->values(
        array(
            'name' => '?'
        )
    )
    ->setValue('password', '?');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::values()

Specifies values for an insert query indexed by column names.
Replaces any previous values, if any.

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder()
    ->insert('users')
    ->values(
        array(
            'name' => '?',
            'password' => '?'
        )
    );

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::having()

Specifies a restriction over the groups of the query.
Replaces any previous having restrictions, if any.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::andHaving()

Adds a restriction over the groups of the query, forming a logical
conjunction with any existing having restrictions.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::orHaving()

Adds a restriction over the groups of the query, forming a logical
disjunction with any existing having restrictions.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::orderBy()

Specifies an ordering for the query results.
Replaces any previously specified orderings, if any.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::addOrderBy()

Adds an ordering to the query results.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getQueryPart()

Gets a query part by its name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::getQueryParts()

Gets all query parts.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::resetQueryParts()

Resets SQL parts.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::resetQueryPart()

Resets a single SQL part.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::__toString()

Gets a string representation of this QueryBuilder which corresponds to
the final SQL query being constructed.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::createNamedParameter()

Creates a new named parameter and bind the value $value to it.

This method provides a shortcut for PDOStatement::bindValue
when using prepared statements.

The parameter $value specifies the value that you want to bind. If
$placeholder is not provided bindValue() will automatically create a
placeholder for you. An automatic placeholder will be of the name
':dcValue1', ':dcValue2' etc.

For more information see

Example:

$value = 2;
$q->eq( 'id', $q->bindValue( $value ) );
$stmt = $q->executeQuery(); // executed with 'id = 2'

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::createPositionalParameter()

Creates a new positional parameter and bind the given value to it.

Attention: If you are using positional parameters with the query builder you have
to be very careful to bind all parameters in the order they appear in the SQL
statement , otherwise they get bound in the wrong order which can lead to serious
bugs in your code.

Example:

$qb = $conn->createQueryBuilder();
$qb->select('u.*')

->from('users', 'u')
->where('u.username = ' . $qb->createPositionalParameter('Foo', ParameterType::STRING))
->orWhere('u.username = ' . $qb->createPositionalParameter('Bar', ParameterType::STRING))

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryBuilder::__clone()

Deep clone of all expression objects in the SQL parts.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException

property Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::$message

property Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::$code

property Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::$line

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::nonUniqueAlias()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::invalidPlatformSpecified()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::invalidPlatformType()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::invalidPlatformVersionSpecified()

Returns a new instance for an invalid specified platform version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::driverRequired()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::unknownDriver()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::driverExceptionDuringQuery()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::__wakeup()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::getCode()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::getFile()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::getLine()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::getTrace()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::getPrevious()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Query\QueryException::getTraceAsString()

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Visitor\AbstractVisitor

Abstract Visitor with empty methods for easy extension.

Schema Visitor used for Validation or Generation purposes.

Accepts a schema namespace name.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset

The abstract asset allows to reset the name of all assets without publishing this to the public userland.

This encapsulation hack is necessary to keep a consistent state of the database schema. Say we have a list of tables
array($tableName => Table($tableName)); if you want to rename the table, you have to make sure

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::$_name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::$_namespace

Namespace of the asset. If none isset the default namespace is assumed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::$_quoted

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::_setName()

Sets the name of this asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::isInDefaultNamespace()

Is this asset in the default namespace?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::getNamespaceName()

Gets the namespace name of this asset.

If NULL is returned this means the default namespace is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::getShortestName()

The shortest name is stripped of the default namespace. All other
namespaced elements are returned as full-qualified names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::getFullQualifiedName()

The normalized name is full-qualified and lowerspaced. Lowerspacing is
actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are
using database objects that only differentiate in the casing (FOO vs
Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

Every non-namespaced element is prefixed with the default namespace
name which is passed as argument to this method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::isQuoted()

Checks if this asset's name is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::isIdentifierQuoted()

Checks if this identifier is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::trimQuotes()

Trim quotes from the identifier.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::getName()

Returns the name of this schema asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::getQuotedName()

Gets the quoted representation of this asset but only if it was defined with one. Otherwise
return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractAsset::_generateIdentifierName()

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column

Object representation of a database column.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_type

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_length

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_precision

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_scale

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_unsigned

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_fixed

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_notnull

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_default

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_autoincrement

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_platformOptions

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_columnDefinition

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_comment

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_customSchemaOptions

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_namespace

Namespace of the asset. If none isset the default namespace is assumed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::$_quoted

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::__construct()

Creates a new Column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::setOptions()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::setLength()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getDefault()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getPlatformOptions()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::hasPlatformOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getPlatformOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getColumnDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getAutoincrement()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::setAutoincrement()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::setComment()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getComment()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::setCustomSchemaOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::hasCustomSchemaOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getCustomSchemaOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::setCustomSchemaOptions()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getCustomSchemaOptions()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::toArray()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::_setName()

Sets the name of this asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::isInDefaultNamespace()

Is this asset in the default namespace?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getNamespaceName()

Gets the namespace name of this asset.

If NULL is returned this means the default namespace is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getShortestName()

The shortest name is stripped of the default namespace. All other
namespaced elements are returned as full-qualified names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getFullQualifiedName()

The normalized name is full-qualified and lowerspaced. Lowerspacing is
actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are
using database objects that only differentiate in the casing (FOO vs
Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

Every non-namespaced element is prefixed with the default namespace
name which is passed as argument to this method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::isQuoted()

Checks if this asset's name is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::isIdentifierQuoted()

Checks if this identifier is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::trimQuotes()

Trim quotes from the identifier.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getName()

Returns the name of this schema asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::getQuotedName()

Gets the quoted representation of this asset but only if it was defined with one. Otherwise
return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Column::_generateIdentifierName()

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff

Table Diff.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$newName

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$addedColumns

All added fields.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$changedColumns

All changed fields.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$removedColumns

All removed fields.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$renamedColumns

Columns that are only renamed from key to column instance name.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$addedIndexes

All added indexes.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$changedIndexes

All changed indexes.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$removedIndexes

All removed indexes

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$renamedIndexes

Indexes that are only renamed but are identical otherwise.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$addedForeignKeys

All added foreign key definitions

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$changedForeignKeys

All changed foreign keys

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\TableDiff::$removedForeignKeys

All removed foreign keys

Constructs an TableDiff object.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table

Object Representation of a table.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_columns

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_indexes

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_primaryKeyName

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_fkConstraints

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_options

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_schemaConfig

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_namespace

Namespace of the asset. If none isset the default namespace is assumed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::$_quoted

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::setSchemaConfig()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::_getMaxIdentifierLength()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::setPrimaryKey()

Sets the Primary Key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::addIndex()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::dropPrimaryKey()

Drops the primary key from this table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::dropIndex()

Drops an index from this table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::addUniqueIndex()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::renameIndex()

Renames an index.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::columnsAreIndexed()

Checks if an index begins in the order of the given columns.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::addColumn()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::renameColumn()

Renames a Column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::changeColumn()

Change Column Details.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::dropColumn()

Drops a Column from the Table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::addForeignKeyConstraint()

Adds a foreign key constraint.

Name is inferred from the local columns.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::addUnnamedForeignKeyConstraint()

Adds a foreign key constraint.

Name is to be generated by the database itself.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::addNamedForeignKeyConstraint()

Adds a foreign key constraint with a given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::addOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::_addColumn()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::_addIndex()

Adds an index to the table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::_addForeignKeyConstraint()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::hasForeignKey()

Returns whether this table has a foreign key constraint with the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getForeignKey()

Returns the foreign key constraint with the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::removeForeignKey()

Removes the foreign key constraint with the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getColumns()

Returns ordered list of columns (primary keys are first, then foreign keys, then the rest)

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::hasColumn()

Returns whether this table has a Column with the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getColumn()

Returns the Column with the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getPrimaryKey()

Returns the primary key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getPrimaryKeyColumns()

Returns the primary key columns.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::hasPrimaryKey()

Returns whether this table has a primary key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::hasIndex()

Returns whether this table has an Index with the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getIndex()

Returns the Index with the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getIndexes()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getForeignKeys()

Returns the foreign key constraints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::hasOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getOption()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getOptions()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::visit()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::__clone()

Clone of a Table triggers a deep clone of all affected assets.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::_setName()

Sets the name of this asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::isInDefaultNamespace()

Is this asset in the default namespace?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getNamespaceName()

Gets the namespace name of this asset.

If NULL is returned this means the default namespace is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getShortestName()

The shortest name is stripped of the default namespace. All other
namespaced elements are returned as full-qualified names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getFullQualifiedName()

The normalized name is full-qualified and lowerspaced. Lowerspacing is
actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are
using database objects that only differentiate in the casing (FOO vs
Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

Every non-namespaced element is prefixed with the default namespace
name which is passed as argument to this method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::isQuoted()

Checks if this asset's name is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::isIdentifierQuoted()

Checks if this identifier is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::trimQuotes()

Trim quotes from the identifier.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getName()

Returns the name of this schema asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::getQuotedName()

Gets the quoted representation of this asset but only if it was defined with one. Otherwise
return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Table::_generateIdentifierName()

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint

An abstraction class for a foreign key constraint.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_localTable

Instance of the referencing table the foreign key constraint is associated with.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_localColumnNames

Asset identifier instances of the referencing table column names the foreign key constraint is associated with.
array($columnName => Identifier)

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_foreignTableName

Table or asset identifier instance of the referenced table name the foreign key constraint is associated with.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_foreignColumnNames

Asset identifier instances of the referenced table column names the foreign key constraint is associated with.
array($columnName => Identifier)

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_options

Options associated with the foreign key constraint.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_namespace

Namespace of the asset. If none isset the default namespace is assumed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::$_quoted

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::__construct()

Initializes the foreign key constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getLocalTableName()

Returns the name of the referencing table
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::setLocalTable()

Sets the Table instance of the referencing table
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getLocalTable()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getLocalColumns()

Returns the names of the referencing table columns
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getQuotedLocalColumns()

Returns the quoted representation of the referencing table column names
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

But only if they were defined with one or the referencing table column name
is a keyword reserved by the platform.
Otherwise the plain unquoted value as inserted is returned.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getUnquotedLocalColumns()

Returns unquoted representation of local table column names for comparison with other FK

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getUnquotedForeignColumns()

Returns unquoted representation of foreign table column names for comparison with other FK

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getColumns()

Returns the names of the referencing table columns
the constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getQuotedColumns()

Returns the quoted representation of the referencing table column names
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

But only if they were defined with one or the referencing table column name
is a keyword reserved by the platform.
Otherwise the plain unquoted value as inserted is returned.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getForeignTableName()

Returns the name of the referenced table
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getUnqualifiedForeignTableName()

Returns the non-schema qualified foreign table name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getQuotedForeignTableName()

Returns the quoted representation of the referenced table name
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

But only if it was defined with one or the referenced table name
is a keyword reserved by the platform.
Otherwise the plain unquoted value as inserted is returned.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getForeignColumns()

Returns the names of the referenced table columns
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getQuotedForeignColumns()

Returns the quoted representation of the referenced table column names
the foreign key constraint is associated with.

But only if they were defined with one or the referenced table column name
is a keyword reserved by the platform.
Otherwise the plain unquoted value as inserted is returned.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::hasOption()

Returns whether or not a given option
is associated with the foreign key constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getOption()

Returns an option associated with the foreign key constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getOptions()

Returns the options associated with the foreign key constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::onUpdate()

Returns the referential action for UPDATE operations
on the referenced table the foreign key constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::onDelete()

Returns the referential action for DELETE operations
on the referenced table the foreign key constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::intersectsIndexColumns()

Checks whether this foreign key constraint intersects the given index columns.

Returns true if at least one of this foreign key's local columns
matches one of the given index's columns, false otherwise.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::_setName()

Sets the name of this asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::isInDefaultNamespace()

Is this asset in the default namespace?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getNamespaceName()

Gets the namespace name of this asset.

If NULL is returned this means the default namespace is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getShortestName()

The shortest name is stripped of the default namespace. All other
namespaced elements are returned as full-qualified names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getFullQualifiedName()

The normalized name is full-qualified and lowerspaced. Lowerspacing is
actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are
using database objects that only differentiate in the casing (FOO vs
Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

Every non-namespaced element is prefixed with the default namespace
name which is passed as argument to this method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::isQuoted()

Checks if this asset's name is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::isIdentifierQuoted()

Checks if this identifier is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::trimQuotes()

Trim quotes from the identifier.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getName()

Returns the name of this schema asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::getQuotedName()

Gets the quoted representation of this asset but only if it was defined with one. Otherwise
return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\ForeignKeyConstraint::_generateIdentifierName()

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema

Object representation of a database schema.

Different vendors have very inconsistent naming with regard to the concept
of a "schema". Doctrine understands a schema as the entity that conceptually
wraps a set of database objects such as tables, sequences, indexes and
foreign keys that belong to each other into a namespace. A Doctrine Schema
has nothing to do with the "SCHEMA" defined as in PostgreSQL, it is more
related to the concept of "DATABASE" that exists in MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Every asset in the doctrine schema has a name. A name consists of either a
namespace.local name pair or just a local unqualified name.

The abstraction layer that covers a PostgreSQL schema is the namespace of an
database object (asset). A schema can have a name, which will be used as
default namespace for the unqualified database objects that are created in
the schema.

In the case of MySQL where cross-database queries are allowed this leads to
databases being "misinterpreted" as namespaces. This is intentional, however
the CREATE/DROP SQL visitors will just filter this queries and do not
execute them. Only the queries for the currently connected database are
executed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::$_tables

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::$_sequences

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::$_schemaConfig

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::$_name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::$_namespace

Namespace of the asset. If none isset the default namespace is assumed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::$_quoted

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::hasExplicitForeignKeyIndexes()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::_addTable()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::_addSequence()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getNamespaces()

Returns the namespaces of this schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getTables()

Gets all tables of this schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getTable()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::hasNamespace()

Does this schema have a namespace with the given name?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::hasTable()

Does this schema have a table with the given name?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getTableNames()

Gets all table names, prefixed with a schema name, even the default one if present.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::hasSequence()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getSequence()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getSequences()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::createNamespace()

Creates a new namespace.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::createTable()

Creates a new table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::renameTable()

Renames a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::dropTable()

Drops a table from the schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::createSequence()

Creates a new sequence.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::dropSequence()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::toSql()

Returns an array of necessary SQL queries to create the schema on the given platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::toDropSql()

Return an array of necessary SQL queries to drop the schema on the given platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getMigrateToSql()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getMigrateFromSql()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::visit()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::__clone()

Cloning a Schema triggers a deep clone of all related assets.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::_setName()

Sets the name of this asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::isInDefaultNamespace()

Is this asset in the default namespace?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getNamespaceName()

Gets the namespace name of this asset.

If NULL is returned this means the default namespace is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getShortestName()

The shortest name is stripped of the default namespace. All other
namespaced elements are returned as full-qualified names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getFullQualifiedName()

The normalized name is full-qualified and lowerspaced. Lowerspacing is
actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are
using database objects that only differentiate in the casing (FOO vs
Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

Every non-namespaced element is prefixed with the default namespace
name which is passed as argument to this method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::isQuoted()

Checks if this asset's name is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::isIdentifierQuoted()

Checks if this identifier is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::trimQuotes()

Trim quotes from the identifier.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getName()

Returns the name of this schema asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::getQuotedName()

Gets the quoted representation of this asset but only if it was defined with one. Otherwise
return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Schema::_generateIdentifierName()

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

Checks if this sequence is an autoincrement sequence for a given table.

This is used inside the comparator to not report sequences as missing,
when the "from" schema implicitly creates the sequences.

actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are

Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier

An abstraction class for an asset identifier.

Wraps identifier names like column names in indexes / foreign keys
in an abstract class for proper quotation capabilities.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::$_name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::$_namespace

Namespace of the asset. If none isset the default namespace is assumed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::$_quoted

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::_setName()

Sets the name of this asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::isInDefaultNamespace()

Is this asset in the default namespace?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::getNamespaceName()

Gets the namespace name of this asset.

If NULL is returned this means the default namespace is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::getShortestName()

The shortest name is stripped of the default namespace. All other
namespaced elements are returned as full-qualified names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::getFullQualifiedName()

The normalized name is full-qualified and lowerspaced. Lowerspacing is
actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are
using database objects that only differentiate in the casing (FOO vs
Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

Every non-namespaced element is prefixed with the default namespace
name which is passed as argument to this method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::isQuoted()

Checks if this asset's name is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::isIdentifierQuoted()

Checks if this identifier is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::trimQuotes()

Trim quotes from the identifier.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::getName()

Returns the name of this schema asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::getQuotedName()

Gets the quoted representation of this asset but only if it was defined with one. Otherwise
return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Identifier::_generateIdentifierName()

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager

Base class for schema managers. Schema managers are used to inspect and/or
modify the database schema/structure.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::$_conn

Holds instance of the Doctrine connection for this schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::$_platform

Holds instance of the database platform used for this schema manager.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::__construct()

Constructor. Accepts the Connection instance to manage the schema for.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::getDatabasePlatform()

Returns the associated platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.


$result = $sm->tryMethod('dropView', 'view_name');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listDatabases()

Lists the available databases for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listNamespaceNames()

Returns a list of all namespaces in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listSequences()

Lists the available sequences for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listTableColumns()

Lists the columns for a given table.

In contrast to other libraries and to the old version of Doctrine,
this column definition does try to contain the 'primary' field for
the reason that it is not portable across different RDBMS. Use
listTableIndexes($tableName) to retrieve the primary key
of a table. We're a RDBMS specifies more details these are held
in the platformDetails array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listTableIndexes()

Lists the indexes for a given table returning an array of Index instances.

Keys of the portable indexes list are all lower-cased.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::tablesExist()

Returns true if all the given tables exist.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listTableNames()

Returns a list of all tables in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::filterAssetNames()

Filters asset names if they are configured to return only a subset of all
the found elements.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::getFilterSchemaAssetsExpression()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listTables()

Lists the tables for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listTableDetails()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listViews()

Lists the views this connection has.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::listTableForeignKeys()

Lists the foreign keys for the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropDatabase()

Drops a database.

NOTE: You can not drop the database this SchemaManager is currently connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropTable()

Drops the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropIndex()

Drops the index from the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropConstraint()

Drops the constraint from the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropForeignKey()

Drops a foreign key from a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropSequence()

Drops a sequence with a given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropView()

Drops a view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createDatabase()

Creates a new database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createTable()

Creates a new table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createSequence()

Creates a new sequence.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createConstraint()

Creates a constraint on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createIndex()

Creates a new index on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createForeignKey()

Creates a new foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createView()

Creates a new view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropAndCreateConstraint()

Drops and creates a constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropAndCreateIndex()

Drops and creates a new index on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropAndCreateForeignKey()

Drops and creates a new foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropAndCreateSequence()

Drops and create a new sequence.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropAndCreateTable()

Drops and creates a new table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropAndCreateDatabase()

Drops and creates a new database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::dropAndCreateView()

Drops and creates a new view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::alterTable()

Alters an existing tables schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::renameTable()

Renames a given table to another name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabasesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::getPortableNamespacesList()

Converts a list of namespace names from the native DBMS data definition to a portable Doctrine definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabaseDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::getPortableNamespaceDefinition()

Converts a namespace definition from the native DBMS data definition to a portable Doctrine definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableFunctionsList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableFunctionDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTriggersList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTriggerDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableSequencesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableSequenceDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnList()

Independent of the database the keys of the column list result are lowercased.

The name of the created column instance however is kept in its case.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnDefinition()

Gets Table Column Definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTableIndexesList()

Aggregates and groups the index results according to the required data result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTablesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTableDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableUsersList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableUserDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableViewsList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableViewDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeysList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeyDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::_execSql()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createSchema()

Creates a schema instance for the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::createSchemaConfig()

Creates the configuration for this schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::getSchemaSearchPaths()

The search path for namespaces in the currently connected database.

The first entry is usually the default namespace in the Schema. All
further namespaces contain tables/sequences which can also be addressed
with a short, not full-qualified name.

For databases that don't support subschema/namespaces this method
returns the name of the currently connected database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::extractDoctrineTypeFromComment()

Given a table comment this method tries to extract a typehint for Doctrine Type, or returns
the type given as default.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager::removeDoctrineTypeFromComment()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager

Schema manager for the Drizzle RDBMS.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::$_conn

Holds instance of the Doctrine connection for this schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::$_platform

Holds instance of the database platform used for this schema manager.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnDefinition()

Gets Table Column Definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabaseDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeyDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableIndexesList()

Aggregates and groups the index results according to the required data result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::__construct()

Constructor. Accepts the Connection instance to manage the schema for.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::getDatabasePlatform()

Returns the associated platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.


$result = $sm->tryMethod('dropView', 'view_name');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::listDatabases()

Lists the available databases for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::listNamespaceNames()

Returns a list of all namespaces in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::listSequences()

Lists the available sequences for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::listTableColumns()

Lists the columns for a given table.

In contrast to other libraries and to the old version of Doctrine,
this column definition does try to contain the 'primary' field for
the reason that it is not portable across different RDBMS. Use
listTableIndexes($tableName) to retrieve the primary key
of a table. We're a RDBMS specifies more details these are held
in the platformDetails array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DrizzleSchemaManager::listTableIndexes()

Lists the indexes for a given table returning an array of Index instances.

Keys of the portable indexes list are all lower-cased.

The first entry is usually the default namespace in the Schema. All
further namespaces contain tables/sequences which can also be addressed
with a short, not full-qualified name.

For databases that don't support subschema/namespaces this method
returns the name of the currently connected database.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager

IBM Db2 Schema Manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::$_conn

Holds instance of the Doctrine connection for this schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::$_platform

Holds instance of the database platform used for this schema manager.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::listTableNames()

Returns a list of all tables in the current database.

Apparently creator is the schema not the user who created it:

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnDefinition()

Gets Table Column Definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::_getPortableTablesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::_getPortableTableIndexesList()
