method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::getDatabasePlatform()

Returns the associated platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\DB2SchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.


$result = $sm->tryMethod('dropView', 'view_name');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::listTableColumns()

Lists the columns for a given table.

In contrast to other libraries and to the old version of Doctrine,
this column definition does try to contain the 'primary' field for
the reason that it is not portable across different RDBMS. Use

of a table. We're a RDBMS specifies more details these are held
in the platformDetails array.

Drops and creates a new database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::dropAndCreateView()

Drops and creates a new view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::alterTable()

Alters an existing tables schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::renameTable()

Renames a given table to another name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabasesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::getPortableNamespacesList()

Converts a list of namespace names from the native DBMS data definition to a portable Doctrine definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::getPortableNamespaceDefinition()

Converts a namespace definition from the native DBMS data definition to a portable Doctrine definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableFunctionsList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableFunctionDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableTriggersList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableTriggerDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableSequencesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnList()

Independent of the database the keys of the column list result are lowercased.

The name of the created column instance however is kept in its case.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableTablesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableUsersList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableViewsList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeyDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::_execSql()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::createSchema()

Creates a schema instance for the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::createSchemaConfig()

Creates the configuration for this schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::getSchemaSearchPaths()

The search path for namespaces in the currently connected database.

The first entry is usually the default namespace in the Schema. All
further namespaces contain tables/sequences which can also be addressed
with a short, not full-qualified name.

For databases that don't support subschema/namespaces this method
returns the name of the currently connected database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::extractDoctrineTypeFromComment()

Given a table comment this method tries to extract a typehint for Doctrine Type, or returns
the type given as default.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\MySqlSchemaManager::removeDoctrineTypeFromComment()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager

Oracle Schema Manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::$_conn

Holds instance of the Doctrine connection for this schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::$_platform

Holds instance of the database platform used for this schema manager.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropDatabase()

Drops a database.

NOTE: You can not drop the database this SchemaManager is currently connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableViewDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableUserDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableIndexesList()

Aggregates and groups the index results according to the required data result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnDefinition()

Gets Table Column Definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeysList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableSequenceDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableFunctionDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabaseDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createDatabase()

Creates a new database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAutoincrement()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropTable()

Drops the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::__construct()

Constructor. Accepts the Connection instance to manage the schema for.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::getDatabasePlatform()

Returns the associated platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.


$result = $sm->tryMethod('dropView', 'view_name');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listDatabases()

Lists the available databases for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listNamespaceNames()

Returns a list of all namespaces in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listSequences()

Lists the available sequences for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listTableColumns()

Lists the columns for a given table.

In contrast to other libraries and to the old version of Doctrine,
this column definition does try to contain the 'primary' field for
the reason that it is not portable across different RDBMS. Use
listTableIndexes($tableName) to retrieve the primary key
of a table. We're a RDBMS specifies more details these are held
in the platformDetails array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listTableIndexes()

Lists the indexes for a given table returning an array of Index instances.

Keys of the portable indexes list are all lower-cased.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::tablesExist()

Returns true if all the given tables exist.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listTableNames()

Returns a list of all tables in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::filterAssetNames()

Filters asset names if they are configured to return only a subset of all
the found elements.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::getFilterSchemaAssetsExpression()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listTables()

Lists the tables for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listTableDetails()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listViews()

Lists the views this connection has.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::listTableForeignKeys()

Lists the foreign keys for the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropIndex()

Drops the index from the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropConstraint()

Drops the constraint from the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropForeignKey()

Drops a foreign key from a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropSequence()

Drops a sequence with a given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropView()

Drops a view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createTable()

Creates a new table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createSequence()

Creates a new sequence.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createConstraint()

Creates a constraint on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createIndex()

Creates a new index on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createForeignKey()

Creates a new foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createView()

Creates a new view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAndCreateConstraint()

Drops and creates a constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAndCreateIndex()

Drops and creates a new index on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAndCreateForeignKey()

Drops and creates a new foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAndCreateSequence()

Drops and create a new sequence.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAndCreateTable()

Drops and creates a new table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAndCreateDatabase()

Drops and creates a new database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::dropAndCreateView()

Drops and creates a new view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::alterTable()

Alters an existing tables schema.

Renames a given table to another name.

Converts a namespace definition from the native DBMS data definition to a portable Doctrine definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableSequencesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnList()

Independent of the database the keys of the column list result are lowercased.

The name of the created column instance however is kept in its case.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableTablesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::_getPortableUsersList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createSchema()

Creates a schema instance for the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::createSchemaConfig()

Creates the configuration for this schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::getSchemaSearchPaths()

The search path for namespaces in the currently connected database.

The first entry is usually the default namespace in the Schema. All
further namespaces contain tables/sequences which can also be addressed
with a short, not full-qualified name.

For databases that don't support subschema/namespaces this method
returns the name of the currently connected database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::extractDoctrineTypeFromComment()

Given a table comment this method tries to extract a typehint for Doctrine Type, or returns
the type given as default.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\OracleSchemaManager::removeDoctrineTypeFromComment()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager

PostgreSQL Schema Manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::$_conn

Holds instance of the Doctrine connection for this schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::$_platform

Holds instance of the database platform used for this schema manager.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::getSchemaNames()

Gets all the existing schema names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::getSchemaSearchPaths()

Returns an array of schema search paths.

This is a PostgreSQL only function.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::getExistingSchemaSearchPaths()

Gets names of all existing schemas in the current users search path.

This is a PostgreSQL only function.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::determineExistingSchemaSearchPaths()

Sets or resets the order of the existing schemas in the current search path of the user.

This is a PostgreSQL only function.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::dropDatabase()

Drops a database.

NOTE: You can not drop the database this SchemaManager is currently connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeyDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\PostgreSqlSchemaManager::_getPortableTriggerDefinition()

instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.

NOTE: You can not drop the database this SchemaManager is currently connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SqliteSchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.

this column definition does try to contain the 'primary' field for
the reason that it is not portable across different RDBMS. Use

of a table. We're a RDBMS specifies more details these are held

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SqliteSchemaManager::getSchemaSearchPaths()

The search path for namespaces in the currently connected database.

The first entry is usually the default namespace in the Schema. All
further namespaces contain tables/sequences which can also be addressed
with a short, not full-qualified name.

For databases that don't support subschema/namespaces this method
returns the name of the currently connected database.

Given a table comment this method tries to extract a typehint for Doctrine Type, or returns
the type given as default.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager

SQL Server Schema Manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::$_conn

Holds instance of the Doctrine connection for this schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::$_platform

Holds instance of the database platform used for this schema manager.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropDatabase()

Drops a database.

NOTE: You can not drop the database this SchemaManager is currently connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableSequenceDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnDefinition()

Gets Table Column Definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeysList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTableIndexesList()

Aggregates and groups the index results according to the required data result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeyDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTableDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabaseDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::getPortableNamespaceDefinition()

Converts a namespace definition from the native DBMS data definition to a portable Doctrine definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableViewDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listTableIndexes()

Lists the indexes for a given table returning an array of Index instances.

Keys of the portable indexes list are all lower-cased.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::alterTable()

Alters an existing tables schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::__construct()

Constructor. Accepts the Connection instance to manage the schema for.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::getDatabasePlatform()

Returns the associated platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.


$result = $sm->tryMethod('dropView', 'view_name');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listDatabases()

Lists the available databases for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listNamespaceNames()

Returns a list of all namespaces in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listSequences()

Lists the available sequences for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listTableColumns()

Lists the columns for a given table.

In contrast to other libraries and to the old version of Doctrine,
this column definition does try to contain the 'primary' field for
the reason that it is not portable across different RDBMS. Use
listTableIndexes($tableName) to retrieve the primary key
of a table. We're a RDBMS specifies more details these are held
in the platformDetails array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::tablesExist()

Returns true if all the given tables exist.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listTableNames()

Returns a list of all tables in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::filterAssetNames()

Filters asset names if they are configured to return only a subset of all
the found elements.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::getFilterSchemaAssetsExpression()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listTables()

Lists the tables for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listTableDetails()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listViews()

Lists the views this connection has.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::listTableForeignKeys()

Lists the foreign keys for the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropTable()

Drops the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropIndex()

Drops the index from the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropConstraint()

Drops the constraint from the given table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropForeignKey()

Drops a foreign key from a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropSequence()

Drops a sequence with a given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropView()

Drops a view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createDatabase()

Creates a new database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createTable()

Creates a new table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createSequence()

Creates a new sequence.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createConstraint()

Creates a constraint on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createIndex()

Creates a new index on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createForeignKey()

Creates a new foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createView()

Creates a new view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropAndCreateConstraint()

Drops and creates a constraint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropAndCreateIndex()

Drops and creates a new index on a table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropAndCreateForeignKey()

Drops and creates a new foreign key.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropAndCreateSequence()

Drops and create a new sequence.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropAndCreateTable()

Drops and creates a new table.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropAndCreateDatabase()

Drops and creates a new database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::dropAndCreateView()

Drops and creates a new view.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::renameTable()

Renames a given table to another name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabasesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::getPortableNamespacesList()

Converts a list of namespace names from the native DBMS data definition to a portable Doctrine definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableFunctionsList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableFunctionDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTriggersList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTriggerDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableSequencesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnList()

Independent of the database the keys of the column list result are lowercased.

The name of the created column instance however is kept in its case.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableTablesList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableUsersList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableUserDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_getPortableViewsList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::_execSql()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createSchema()

Creates a schema instance for the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::createSchemaConfig()

Creates the configuration for this schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::getSchemaSearchPaths()

The search path for namespaces in the currently connected database.

The first entry is usually the default namespace in the Schema. All
further namespaces contain tables/sequences which can also be addressed
with a short, not full-qualified name.

For databases that don't support subschema/namespaces this method
returns the name of the currently connected database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::extractDoctrineTypeFromComment()

Given a table comment this method tries to extract a typehint for Doctrine Type, or returns
the type given as default.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLServerSchemaManager::removeDoctrineTypeFromComment()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager

SAP Sybase SQL Anywhere schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::$_conn

Holds instance of the Doctrine connection for this schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::$_platform

Holds instance of the database platform used for this schema manager.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::createDatabase()

Creates a new database.

Starts a database after creation
as SQL Anywhere needs a database to be started
before it can be used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::dropDatabase()

Drops a database.

NOTE: You can not drop the database this SchemaManager is currently connected to.

Tries stopping a database before dropping
as SQL Anywhere needs a database to be stopped
before it can be dropped.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::startDatabase()

Starts a database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::stopDatabase()

Stops a database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableDatabaseDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableSequenceDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableTableColumnDefinition()

Gets Table Column Definition.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableTableDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeyDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableTableForeignKeysList()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableTableIndexesList()

Aggregates and groups the index results according to the required data result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::_getPortableViewDefinition()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::__construct()

Constructor. Accepts the Connection instance to manage the schema for.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::getDatabasePlatform()

Returns the associated platform.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::tryMethod()

Tries any method on the schema manager. Normally a method throws an
exception when your DBMS doesn't support it or if an error occurs.
This method allows you to try and method on your SchemaManager
instance and will return false if it does not work or is not supported.


$result = $sm->tryMethod('dropView', 'view_name');

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::listDatabases()

Lists the available databases for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::listNamespaceNames()

Returns a list of all namespaces in the current database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::listSequences()

Lists the available sequences for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::listTableColumns()

Lists the columns for a given table.

In contrast to other libraries and to the old version of Doctrine,
this column definition does try to contain the 'primary' field for
the reason that it is not portable across different RDBMS. Use
listTableIndexes($tableName) to retrieve the primary key
of a table. We're a RDBMS specifies more details these are held
in the platformDetails array.

Keys of the portable indexes list are all lower-cased.

Creates the configuration for this schema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::getSchemaSearchPaths()

The search path for namespaces in the currently connected database.

The first entry is usually the default namespace in the Schema. All
further namespaces contain tables/sequences which can also be addressed
with a short, not full-qualified name.

For databases that don't support subschema/namespaces this method
returns the name of the currently connected database.

Given a table comment this method tries to extract a typehint for Doctrine Type, or returns
the type given as default.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SQLAnywhereSchemaManager::removeDoctrineTypeFromComment()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View

Representation of a Database View.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::$_name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::$_namespace

Namespace of the asset. If none isset the default namespace is assumed.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::$_quoted

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::__construct()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::getSql()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::_setName()

Sets the name of this asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::isInDefaultNamespace()

Is this asset in the default namespace?

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::getNamespaceName()

Gets the namespace name of this asset.

If NULL is returned this means the default namespace is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::getShortestName()

The shortest name is stripped of the default namespace. All other
namespaced elements are returned as full-qualified names.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::getFullQualifiedName()

The normalized name is full-qualified and lowerspaced. Lowerspacing is
actually wrong, but we have to do it to keep our sanity. If you are
using database objects that only differentiate in the casing (FOO vs
Foo) then you will NOT be able to use Doctrine Schema abstraction.

Every non-namespaced element is prefixed with the default namespace
name which is passed as argument to this method.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::isQuoted()

Checks if this asset's name is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::isIdentifierQuoted()

Checks if this identifier is quoted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::trimQuotes()

Trim quotes from the identifier.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::getName()

Returns the name of this schema asset.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::getQuotedName()

Gets the quoted representation of this asset but only if it was defined with one. Otherwise
return the plain unquoted value as inserted.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\View::_generateIdentifierName()

Generates an identifier from a list of column names obeying a certain string length.

This is especially important for Oracle, since it does not allow identifiers larger than 30 chars,
however building idents automatically for foreign keys, composite keys or such can easily create
very long names.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig

Configuration for a Schema.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::$hasExplicitForeignKeyIndexes

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::$maxIdentifierLength

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::$name

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::$defaultTableOptions

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::hasExplicitForeignKeyIndexes()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::setExplicitForeignKeyIndexes()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::setMaxIdentifierLength()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::getMaxIdentifierLength()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::getName()

Gets the default namespace of schema objects.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::setName()

Sets the default namespace name of schema objects.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::getDefaultTableOptions()

Gets the default options that are passed to Table instances created with
Schema#createTable().

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaConfig::setDefaultTableOptions()

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator

Compares two Schemas and return an instance of SchemaDiff.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator::compareSchemas()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator::compare()

Returns a SchemaDiff object containing the differences between the schemas $fromSchema and $toSchema.

The returned differences are returned in such a way that they contain the
operations to change the schema stored in $fromSchema to the schema that is
stored in $toSchema.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator::diffSequence()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator::diffTable()

Returns the difference between the tables $table1 and $table2.

If there are no differences this method returns the boolean false.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator::diffForeignKey()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator::diffColumn()

Returns the difference between the fields $field1 and $field2.

If there are differences this method returns $field2, otherwise the
boolean false.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Comparator::diffIndex()

Finds the difference between the indexes $index1 and $index2.

Compares $index1 with $index2 and returns $index2 if there are any
differences or false in case there are no differences.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff

Schema Diff.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$fromSchema

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$newNamespaces

All added namespaces.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$removedNamespaces

All removed namespaces.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$newTables

All added tables.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$changedTables

All changed tables.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$removedTables

All removed tables.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$newSequences

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$changedSequences

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$removedSequences

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::$orphanedForeignKeys

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::__construct()

Constructs an SchemaDiff object.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::toSaveSql()

The to save sql mode ensures that the following things don't happen:

  1. Tables are deleted
  2. Sequences are deleted
  3. Foreign Keys which reference tables that would otherwise be deleted.

This way it is ensured that assets are deleted which might not be relevant to the metadata schema at all.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::toSql()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaDiff::_toSql()

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Constraint

Marker interface for constraints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Constraint::getName()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Constraint::getQuotedName()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Constraint::getColumns()

Returns the names of the referencing table columns
the constraint is associated with.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\Constraint::getQuotedColumns()

Returns the quoted representation of the column names
the constraint is associated with.

But only if they were defined with one or a column name
is a keyword reserved by the platform.
Otherwise the plain unquoted value as inserted is returned.

namespace Doctrine\DBAL\Types\

class Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type

The base class for so-called Doctrine mapping types.

A Type object is obtained by calling the static Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getType() method.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::TARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::SIMPLE_ARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::JSON_ARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::JSON

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::BIGINT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::BOOLEAN

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DATETIME

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DATETIME_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DATETIMETZ

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DATETIMETZ_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DATE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DATE_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::TIME

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::TIME_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DECIMAL

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::INTEGER

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::OBJECT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::SMALLINT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::STRING

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::TEXT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::BINARY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::BLOB

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::FLOAT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::GUID

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::DATEINTERVAL

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::convertToDatabaseValue()

Converts a value from its PHP representation to its database representation
of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::convertToPHPValue()

Converts a value from its database representation to its PHP representation
of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getDefaultLength()

Gets the default length of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getSQLDeclaration()

Gets the SQL declaration snippet for a field of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getName()

Gets the name of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getType()

Factory method to create type instances.
Type instances are implemented as flyweights.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::addType()

Adds a custom type to the type map.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::hasType()

Checks if exists support for a type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::overrideType()

Overrides an already defined type to use a different implementation.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getBindingType()

Gets the (preferred) binding type for values of this type that
can be used when binding parameters to prepared statements.

This method should return one of the Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType constants.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getTypesMap()

Gets the types array map which holds all registered types and the corresponding
type class

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::__toString()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::canRequireSQLConversion()

Does working with this column require SQL conversion functions?

This is a metadata function that is required for example in the ORM.
Usage of convertToDatabaseValueSQL and
convertToPHPValueSQL works for any type and mostly
does nothing. This method can additionally be used for optimization purposes.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::convertToDatabaseValueSQL()

Modifies the SQL expression (identifier, parameter) to convert to a database value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::convertToPHPValueSQL()

Modifies the SQL expression (identifier, parameter) to convert to a PHP value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::getMappedDatabaseTypes()

Gets an array of database types that map to this Doctrine type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type::requiresSQLCommentHint()

If this Doctrine Type maps to an already mapped database type,
reverse schema engineering can't tell them apart. You need to mark
one of those types as commented, which will have Doctrine use an SQL
comment to typehint the actual Doctrine Type.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType

Type that maps ab SQL BINARY/VARBINARY to a PHP resource stream.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::TARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::SIMPLE_ARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::JSON_ARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::JSON

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::BIGINT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::BOOLEAN

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DATETIME

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DATETIME_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DATETIMETZ

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DATETIMETZ_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DATE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DATE_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::TIME

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::TIME_IMMUTABLE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DECIMAL

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::INTEGER

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::OBJECT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::SMALLINT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::STRING

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::TEXT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::BINARY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::BLOB

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::FLOAT

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::GUID

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::DATEINTERVAL

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::getSQLDeclaration()

Gets the SQL declaration snippet for a field of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::convertToPHPValue()

Converts a value from its database representation to its PHP representation
of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::getName()

Gets the name of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::getBindingType()

Gets the (preferred) binding type for values of this type that
can be used when binding parameters to prepared statements.

This method should return one of the Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType constants.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::convertToDatabaseValue()

Converts a value from its PHP representation to its database representation
of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::getDefaultLength()

Gets the default length of this type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::getType()

Factory method to create type instances.
Type instances are implemented as flyweights.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::addType()

Adds a custom type to the type map.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::hasType()

Checks if exists support for a type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::overrideType()

Overrides an already defined type to use a different implementation.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::getTypesMap()

Gets the types array map which holds all registered types and the corresponding
type class

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::__toString()

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::canRequireSQLConversion()

Does working with this column require SQL conversion functions?

This is a metadata function that is required for example in the ORM.
Usage of convertToDatabaseValueSQL and
convertToPHPValueSQL works for any type and mostly
does nothing. This method can additionally be used for optimization purposes.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::convertToDatabaseValueSQL()

Modifies the SQL expression (identifier, parameter) to convert to a database value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::convertToPHPValueSQL()

Modifies the SQL expression (identifier, parameter) to convert to a PHP value.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::getMappedDatabaseTypes()

Gets an array of database types that map to this Doctrine type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BinaryType::requiresSQLCommentHint()

If this Doctrine Type maps to an already mapped database type,
reverse schema engineering can't tell them apart. You need to mark
one of those types as commented, which will have Doctrine use an SQL
comment to typehint the actual Doctrine Type.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BlobType

Type that maps an SQL BLOB to a PHP resource stream.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BlobType::TARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BlobType::SIMPLE_ARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BlobType::JSON_ARRAY

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Types\BlobType::JSON

of this type.

can be used when binding parameters to prepared statements.

This method should return one of the Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType constants.

of this type.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Types\PhpIntegerMappingType

Implementations should map a database type to a PHP integer.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Connection

A wrapper around a Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection that adds features like
events, transaction isolation levels, configuration, emulated transaction nesting,
lazy connecting and more.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED

Constant for transaction isolation level READ UNCOMMITTED.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED

Constant for transaction isolation level READ COMMITTED.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ

Constant for transaction isolation level REPEATABLE READ.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE

Constant for transaction isolation level SERIALIZABLE.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::PARAM_INT_ARRAY

Represents an array of ints to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::PARAM_STR_ARRAY

Represents an array of strings to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::ARRAY_PARAM_OFFSET

Offset by which PARAM_* constants are detected as arrays of the param type.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::$_conn

The wrapped driver connection.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::$_config

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::$_eventManager

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::$_expr

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::$_schemaManager

The schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::$_driver

The used DBAL driver.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::$defaultFetchMode

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::__construct()

Initializes a new instance of the Connection class.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getParams()

Gets the parameters used during instantiation.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getDatabase()

Gets the name of the database this Connection is connected to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getHost()

Gets the hostname of the currently connected database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getPort()

Gets the port of the currently connected database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getUsername()

Gets the username used by this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getPassword()

Gets the password used by this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getDriver()

Gets the DBAL driver instance.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getConfiguration()

Gets the Configuration used by the Connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getEventManager()

Gets the EventManager used by the Connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getDatabasePlatform()

Gets the DatabasePlatform for the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getExpressionBuilder()

Gets the ExpressionBuilder for the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::connect()

Establishes the connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isAutoCommit()

Returns the current auto-commit mode for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setAutoCommit()

Sets auto-commit mode for this connection.

If a connection is in auto-commit mode, then all its SQL statements will be executed and committed as individual
transactions. Otherwise, its SQL statements are grouped into transactions that are terminated by a call to either
the method commit or the method rollback. By default, new connections are in auto-commit mode.

NOTE: If this method is called during a transaction and the auto-commit mode is changed, the transaction is
committed. If this method is called and the auto-commit mode is not changed, the call is a no-op.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setFetchMode()

Sets the fetch mode.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchAssoc()

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the first row of the result
as an associative array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchArray()

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the first row of the result
as a numerically indexed array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchColumn()

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the value of a single column
of the first row of the result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isConnected()

Whether an actual connection to the database is established.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isTransactionActive()

Checks whether a transaction is currently active.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::delete()

Executes an SQL DELETE statement on a table.

Table expression and columns are not escaped and are not safe for user-input.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::close()

Closes the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setTransactionIsolation()

Sets the transaction isolation level.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getTransactionIsolation()

Gets the currently active transaction isolation level.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::update()

Executes an SQL UPDATE statement on a table.

Table expression and columns are not escaped and are not safe for user-input.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::insert()

Inserts a table row with specified data.

Table expression and columns are not escaped and are not safe for user-input.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::quoteIdentifier()

Quotes a string so it can be safely used as a table or column name, even if
it is a reserved name.

Delimiting style depends on the underlying database platform that is being used.

NOTE: Just because you CAN use quoted identifiers does not mean
you SHOULD use them. In general, they end up causing way more
problems than they solve.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::quote()

Quotes a given input parameter.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchAll()

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an associative array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::prepare()

Prepares an SQL statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeQuery()

Executes an, optionally parametrized, SQL query.

If the query is parametrized, a prepared statement is used.
If an SQLLogger is configured, the execution is logged.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeCacheQuery()

Executes a caching query.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::project()

Executes an, optionally parametrized, SQL query and returns the result,
applying a given projection/transformation function on each row of the result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::query()

Executes an SQL statement, returning a result set as a Statement object.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeUpdate()

Executes an SQL INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE query with the given parameters
and returns the number of affected rows.

This method supports PDO binding types as well as DBAL mapping types.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::exec()

Executes an SQL statement and return the number of affected rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getTransactionNestingLevel()

Returns the current transaction nesting level.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::errorCode()

Fetches the SQLSTATE associated with the last database operation.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::errorInfo()

Returns extended error information associated with the last operation on the database handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::lastInsertId()

Returns the ID of the last inserted row, or the last value from a sequence object,
depending on the underlying driver.

Note: This method may not return a meaningful or consistent result across different drivers,
because the underlying database may not even support the notion of AUTO_INCREMENT/IDENTITY
columns or sequences.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::transactional()

Executes a function in a transaction.

The function gets passed this Connection instance as an (optional) parameter.

If an exception occurs during execution of the function or transaction commit,
the transaction is rolled back and the exception re-thrown.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setNestTransactionsWithSavepoints()

Sets if nested transactions should use savepoints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getNestTransactionsWithSavepoints()

Gets if nested transactions should use savepoints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_getNestedTransactionSavePointName()

Returns the savepoint name to use for nested transactions are false if they are not supported
"savepointFormat" parameter is not set

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::beginTransaction()

Starts a transaction by suspending auto-commit mode.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::commit()

Commits the current transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::rollBack()

Cancels any database changes done during the current transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::createSavepoint()

Creates a new savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::releaseSavepoint()

Releases the given savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::rollbackSavepoint()

Rolls back to the given savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getWrappedConnection()

Gets the wrapped driver connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getSchemaManager()

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect or change the
database schema through the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setRollbackOnly()

Marks the current transaction so that the only possible
outcome for the transaction to be rolled back.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isRollbackOnly()

Checks whether the current transaction is marked for rollback only.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::convertToDatabaseValue()

Converts a given value to its database representation according to the conversion
rules of a specific DBAL mapping type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::convertToPHPValue()

Converts a given value to its PHP representation according to the conversion
rules of a specific DBAL mapping type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::resolveParams()

Resolves the parameters to a format which can be displayed.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::createQueryBuilder()

Creates a new instance of a SQL query builder.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::ping()

Ping the server

When the server is not available the method returns FALSE.
It is responsibility of the developer to handle this case
and abort the request or reconnect manually:

class Doctrine\DBAL\FetchMode

Contains statement fetch modes.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\FetchMode::ASSOCIATIVE

Specifies that the fetch method shall return each row as an array indexed
by column name as returned in the corresponding result set. If the result
set contains multiple columns with the same name, the statement returns
only a single value per column name.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\FetchMode::NUMERIC

Specifies that the fetch method shall return each row as an array indexed
by column number as returned in the corresponding result set, starting at
column 0.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\FetchMode::MIXED

Specifies that the fetch method shall return each row as an array indexed
by both column name and number as returned in the corresponding result set,
starting at column 0.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\FetchMode::STANDARD_OBJECT

Specifies that the fetch method shall return each row as an object with
property names that correspond to the column names returned in the result
set.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\FetchMode::COLUMN

Specifies that the fetch method shall return only a single requested
column from the next row in the result set.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\FetchMode::CUSTOM_OBJECT

Specifies that the fetch method shall return a new instance of the
requested class, mapping the columns to named properties in the class.

class Doctrine\DBAL\DBALException

property Doctrine\DBAL\DBALException::$message

property Doctrine\DBAL\DBALException::$code

property Doctrine\DBAL\DBALException::$file

property Doctrine\DBAL\DBALException::$line

class Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType

Contains statement parameter types.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::NULL

Represents the SQL NULL data type.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::INTEGER

Represents the SQL INTEGER data type.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::STRING

Represents the SQL CHAR, VARCHAR, or other string data type.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::LARGE_OBJECT

Represents the SQL large object data type.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::BOOLEAN

Represents a boolean data type.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::BINARY

Represents a binary string data type.

This class cannot be instantiated.

class Doctrine\DBAL\DriverManager

Factory for creating Doctrine\DBAL\Connection instances.

method Doctrine\DBAL\DriverManager::getConnection()

Creates a connection object based on the specified parameters.
This method returns a Doctrine\DBAL\Connection which wraps the underlying
driver connection.

$params must contain at least one of the following.

Either 'driver' with one of the following values:

pdo_mysql
pdo_sqlite
pdo_pgsql
pdo_oci (unstable)
pdo_sqlsrv
pdo_sqlsrv
mysqli
sqlanywhere
sqlsrv
ibm_db2 (unstable)
drizzle_pdo_mysql

OR 'driverClass' that contains the full class name (with namespace) of the
driver class to instantiate.

Other (optional) parameters:

user (string):
The username to use when connecting.

password (string):
The password to use when connecting.

driverOptions (array):
Any additional driver-specific options for the driver. These are just passed
through to the driver.

pdo:
You can pass an existing PDO instance through this parameter. The PDO
instance will be wrapped in a Doctrine\DBAL\Connection.

wrapperClass:
You may specify a custom wrapper class through the 'wrapperClass'
parameter but this class MUST inherit from Doctrine\DBAL\Connection.

driverClass:
The driver class to use.

method Doctrine\DBAL\DriverManager::getAvailableDrivers()

Returns the list of supported drivers.

class Doctrine\DBAL\LockMode

Contains all DBAL LockModes.

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\LockMode::NONE

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\LockMode::OPTIMISTIC

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\LockMode::PESSIMISTIC_READ

classconstant Doctrine\DBAL\LockMode::PESSIMISTIC_WRITE

class Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration

Configuration container for the Doctrine DBAL.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::$_attributes

The attributes that are contained in the configuration.
Values are default values.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setSQLLogger()

Sets the SQL logger to use. Defaults to NULL which means SQL logging is disabled.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getSQLLogger()

Gets the SQL logger that is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getResultCacheImpl()

Gets the cache driver implementation that is used for query result caching.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setResultCacheImpl()

Sets the cache driver implementation that is used for query result caching.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setFilterSchemaAssetsExpression()

Sets the filter schema assets expression.

Only include tables/sequences matching the filter expression regexp in
schema instances generated for the active connection when calling
{AbstractSchemaManager#createSchema()}.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getFilterSchemaAssetsExpression()

Returns filter schema assets expression.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setSchemaAssetsFilter()

Sets the callable to use to filter schema assets.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getSchemaAssetsFilter()

Returns the callable to use to filter schema assets.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setAutoCommit()

Sets the default auto-commit mode for connections.

If a connection is in auto-commit mode, then all its SQL statements will be executed and committed as individual
transactions. Otherwise, its SQL statements are grouped into transactions that are terminated by a call to either
the method commit or the method rollback. By default, new connections are in auto-commit mode.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getAutoCommit()

Returns the default auto-commit mode for connections.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Statement

A thin wrapper around a Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement that adds support
for logging, DBAL mapping types, etc.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::$sql

The SQL statement.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::$params

The bound parameters.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::$types

The parameter types.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::$stmt

The underlying driver statement.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::$platform

The underlying database platform.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::$conn

The connection this statement is bound to and executed on.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::__construct()

Creates a new Statement for the given SQL and Connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::bindValue()

Binds a parameter value to the statement.

The value can optionally be bound with a PDO binding type or a DBAL mapping type.
If bound with a DBAL mapping type, the binding type is derived from the mapping
type and the value undergoes the conversion routines of the mapping type before
being bound.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::bindParam()

Binds a parameter to a value by reference.

Binding a parameter by reference does not support DBAL mapping types.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::execute()

Executes the statement with the currently bound parameters.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::closeCursor()

Closes the cursor, freeing the database resources used by this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::columnCount()

Returns the number of columns in the result set.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::errorCode()

Fetches the SQLSTATE associated with the last operation on the statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::errorInfo()

Fetches extended error information associated with the last operation on the statement handle.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::setFetchMode()

Sets the fetch mode to use while iterating this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::getIterator()

Required by interface IteratorAggregate.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::fetch()

Returns the next row of a result set.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::fetchAll()

Returns an array containing all of the result set rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::fetchColumn()

Returns a single column from the next row of a result set or FALSE if there are no more rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::rowCount()

Returns the number of rows affected by the last execution of this statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::getWrappedStatement()

Gets the wrapped driver statement.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Driver

Driver interface.
Interface that all DBAL drivers must implement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::connect()

Attempts to create a connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::getDatabasePlatform()

Gets the DatabasePlatform instance that provides all the metadata about
the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::getSchemaManager()

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect and change the underlying
database schema of the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::getName()

Gets the name of the driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::getDatabase()

Gets the name of the database connected to for this driver.

interface Doctrine\DBAL\VersionAwarePlatformDriver

Contract for a driver that is able to create platform instances by version.

Doctrine uses different platform classes for different vendor versions to
support the correct features and SQL syntax of each version.
This interface should be implemented by drivers that are capable to do this
distinction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\VersionAwarePlatformDriver::createDatabasePlatformForVersion()

Factory method for creating the appropriate platform instance for the given version.

namespace ryunosuke\

namespace ryunosuke\dbml\


ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder ryunosuke\dbml\Database::fetchArray()

ini
ryunosuke\dbml\Metadata\Schema


ryunosuke\dbml\Database::__construct()
FilesystemCache ApcuCache

$tableDescriptor ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\TableDescriptor

  • base: '(joinsign)tablename(pkval)@scope:fkeyname[condition]+order-by#offset-limit AS Alias.col1, col2 AS C2'
joinsignJOIN '*':CROSS, '+':INNER, '<':LEFT, '>':RIGHT, '~':AUTO, ',':FROM
tablename
(pkval)
@scope Gateway scope
:fkeynameJOIN
[condition]JOIN yaml where
{condition}JOIN yaml
#offset-limitLIMIT, OFFSET
+order-byORDER BY
AS Alias
.col1, col2 AS C2

base JOIN

  • auto join: 'base~base'
  • inner join: 'base+base'
  • left join: 'base<base'
  • subselect: 'base/base'


SQL SELECT FROM JOIN WHERE ORDER LIMIT

base

# tablename 
$db->select('t_article');
// SELECT * FROM t_article

# @scope t_article  active where: delete_flg=0
$db->select('t_article@active');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0

# @scope t_article  latest order: create_time DESC
$db->select('t_article@active@latest');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0 ORDER BY t_article.create_time DESC

# yaml Database::whereInto 
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2]');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE (t_article.delete_flg = 0) AND ((t_article.flag = 1) AND (t_article.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY t_article.create_time DESC

# (pkval) 
$db->select('t_article(1)');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE article_id = 1

# #offset-limit 
$db->select('t_article#40-60');
// SELECT * FROM t_article LIMIT 20 OFFSET 40

# AS alias 
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A');
// SELECT * FROM t_article AS A WHERE (A.delete_flg = 0) AND ((A.flag = 1) AND (A.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY A.create_time DESC

# .
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id');
// SELECT A.article_id FROM t_article AS A WHERE (A.delete_flg = 0) AND ((A.flag = 1) AND (A.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY A.create_time DESC

# ,
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id, title AS T');
// SELECT A.article_id, A.title AS T FROM t_article AS A WHERE (A.delete_flg = 0) AND ((A.flag = 1) AND (A.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY A.create_time DESC

join

# :fkeyname  JOIN t_article  t_comment  fkeyAC: article_id 
$db->select('t_article<t_comment:fkeyAC');
$db->select('t_article<t_comment'); // 
// SELECT t_article.*, t_comment.* FROM t_article LEFT JOIN t_comment ON (t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id)

# [condition]  JOIN yaml  where 
$db->select('t_article<t_comment[delete_flg=0]');
// SELECT t_article.*, t_comment.* FROM t_article LEFT JOIN t_comment ON (t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id) AND (delete_flg=0)

#  base 
$db->select('t_article@active[article_id=9] AS A.article_id+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C.comment');
// SELECT A.article_id, C.comment FROM t_article AS A INNER JOIN t_comment AS C ON (C.article_id = T.article_id) WHERE article_id=9

subselect

# 
$db->selectArray('t_article/t_comment');
// SELECT t_article.*, t_article.article_id FROM t_article
// SELECT t_comment.comment_id AS comment_id, t_comment.* FROM t_comment WHERE t_comment.article_id IN ('1', '2', ...)

#  base 
$db->selectArray('t_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A.article_id/t_comment AS C.comment');
// SELECT A.article_id FROM t_article AS A WHERE delete_flg=0
// SELECT C.comment_id AS __dbml_auto_pk, C.comment, C.article_id AS __dbml_auto_ck FROM t_comment AS C WHERE C.article_id IN ('1', '2', ...)





# base 
$db->select([
    't_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A' => [
        'article_id',
        'T' => 'title',
    ],
]);
// : $db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id, title AS T');

# join 
$db->select([
    't_article@active[article_id=9] AS A' => [
        'article_id',
        // JOIN  JOIN 
        '+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C' => [
            //  ON 
            // ['on1' => 1, 'on2' => 2],
            'comment',
        ],
    ],
]);
// : $db->select('t_article@active[article_id=9] AS A.article_id+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C.comment');

# subselect 
$db->selectArray([
    't_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A' => [
        'article_id',
        // JOIN  subselect 
        't_comment AS C' => [
            'comment',
        ],
    ],
]);
// : $db->selectArray('t_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A.article_id/t_comment AS C.comment');

:fkeyname [condition] 2 $where
JOIN php
$db->select Gateway 

# base 
$db->select([
    't_article@active@latest A' => [
        'article_id',
        'T' => 'title',
    ]
], [
    'flag2'     => 1,
    'flag2 < ?' => 2,
]);
# base  Gateway 
$db->t_article->as('A')->scope('active latest')->column([
    'article_id',
    'T' => 'title',
])->where([
    'flag2'     => 1,
    'flag2 < ?' => 2,
])->select();
// 2: $db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id, title AS T');

# join 
$db->select([
    't_article@active A' => [
        'article_id',
        '+t_comment C' => [
            'comment',
        ],
    ]
], [
    'article_id' => 9,
]);
# join  Gateway 
$db->t_article->as('A')->scope('active')->column([
    'article_id',
    '+t_comment' => $db->t_comment->as('C')->foreign('fkeyAC')->column('comment'),
])->where([
    'article_id' => 9,
])->select();
// 2: $db->select('t_article@active[article_id=9] AS A.article_id+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C.comment');

# subselect 
$db->selectArray([
    't_article@latest A' => [
        'article_id',
        't_comment C' => [
            'comment',
        ],
    ]
], [
    'delete_flg' => 0,
]);
# subselect  Gateway 
$db->t_article->as('A')->scope('latest')->column([
    'article_id',
    't_comment' => $db->t_comment->as('C')->column('comment'),
])->where([
    'delete_flg' => 0,
])->array();
// 2: $db->selectArray('t_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A.article_id/t_comment AS C.comment');

php
ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::column() ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\TableDescriptor 

$db = new Database($connection, [
    //   
    'entityMapper'    => function ($tablename) {
        return 'vendor\\Entity\\' . ucfirst(preg_replace('#^t_#', '', $tablename));
    }
]);

DB
"t_article" php "Article"

entityMapper php
vendor\\Entity\\Article Article 

$db->selectArray('Article.*');
$db->selectArray('t_article.*');

$db->insert('Article', $dataarray);
$db->insert('t_article', $dataarray);

SELECT t_article Article Article t_article
t_article Article Article t_article
SQL "t_article" "Article"


11

DB

t_article select Article cast()
t_ancestor.***
$qb->cast(null) ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::cast()
$db->Article Article TableGateway

t_article Article

  • $db->t_article
  • $db->Article

Gateway
array, tuple

  • $db->t_article->tuple('*', ['id' => 1]);
  • $db->Article->tuple('*', ['id' => 1]);

1 1
entityMapper

TableA TableB

TableA TableB



tableA           tableB           tableC
                                   PK(auto)
                  PK(auto) <-----  FK
 PK(auto) <-----  FK


tableA           tableB           tableC
 PK1      <-----  PK1 & FK <-----  PK1 & FK
                  PK2      <-----  PK2 & FK
                                   PK3


tableA tableC tableB
tableB tableA tableC

tableA tableC 

// 
$db->tableA()->tableC()->array();

// tableA  tableC  JOIN 
// SELECT tableA.*,tableC.* FROM tableA INNER JOIN tableC ON tableA.PK1 = tableC.PK1


join, subselect, subexists

id@integer integer @integer
Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type

ryunosuke\dbml\Database::fetchValue() false false @boolean fetchValue

@ autoCastSuffix null
null


PDO::ATTR_EMULATE_PREPARES PDO::ATTR_STRINGIFY_FETCHES

autoCastType DB Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type
autoCastSuffix @ SELECT INSERT/UPDATE 

// 
$db->setAutoCastType([
    // DATETIME 
    Type::DATETIME => [
        'select' => true,
        'affect' => false,
    ],
    // SARRAY 
    Type::SIMPLE_ARRAY => true,
]);
$row = $db->selectTuple('t_article', ['id' => 1]);
// t_article  public_time: DATETIME 
var_dump($row['public_time']);
// results:  DateTime 
class DateTime#2 (3) {
  public $date =>
  string(26) "2017-12-07 21:42:56.000000"
  public $timezone_type =>
  int(3)
  public $timezone =>
  string(10) "Asia/Tokyo"
}

// t_article  public_option: SARRAY( TEXT) 
var_dump($row['public_option']);
// results: 
array(3) {
  [0] =>
  string(2) "10"
  [1] =>
  string(2) "30"
  [2] =>
  string(2) "50"
}
//  SARRAY 
$db->insert('t_article', [
    'article_id'    => 1,
    'public_option' => ['10', '30', '50'],
]);
//  insert Array to string conversion

autoCastSuffix
mysql DBMS

Gateway Entity
Gateway

namespace ryunosuke\dbml\Entity\

class ryunosuke\dbml\Entity\Entity

method ryunosuke\dbml\Entity\Entity::__construct()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Entity\Entity::__call()

namespace ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\

class ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

Database $table
Database QueryBuilder 

//  Database 
$gw = $db->table_name;   // 
$gw = $db->table_name(); // 

// 
$gw->array('*');
// id
$gw->lists('id');

// (1, 2)1
$gw->find(1, 2);

//  bool 
$gw->exists();
$gw->('*', ['status' => 'deleted']);
// id 
$gw->min('id');

// 
$gw->array([
    //  array 
    'childarray' => $db->child()->subArray(),
    // assoc 
    'childassoc' => $db->child(),
]);

//  JOIN 
$gw->array([
    // INNER JOIN
    '+children1' => $db->child(),
    // LEFT JOIN
    '<children2' => $db->child(),
]);

// 
$gw->array([
    'subcount' => $db->child->subcount(),
    'submin'   => $db->child->submin('child_id'),
    'submax'   => $db->child->submax('child_id'),
    'subsum'   => $db->child->subsum('child_id'),
    'subavg'   => $db->child->subavg('child_id'),
]);

// 
$gw->insert(['data array']);
// 
$gw->update(['data array'], ['where array']);
// 
$gw->delete(['where array']);

// 
$gw[1]['hoge_count'] += 1;                         //  SELECT + UPDATE 
$gw[1]['hoge_count'] = $db->raw('hoge_count + 1'); //

SELECT WHERE

addScope scope
addScope 1 Closure
Closure
Closure $this Gateway bind $this->alias

scoping
column where orderBy 

// select  `NOW()` 
$gw->addScope('', 'NOW()');
// select  `WHERE delete_flg=0` 
$gw->addScope('active', [], ['delete_flg' => 0]);
// select  `ORDER BY create_date DESC LIMIT 10` 
$gw->addScope('latest', function ($limit = 10) {
    return [
        'orderBy' => 'create_date DESC',
        'limit'   => $limit,
    ];
});

// 'active' 
$gw->scope('active')->array();
//  SELECT NOW(), t_table.* FROM t_table WHERE t_table.delete_flg = 0
// NOW() 

//  active, latest 
$gw->noscope()->scope('active')->scope('latest')->array();
//  SELECT t_table.* FROM t_table WHERE t_table.delete_flg = 0 ORDER BY t_table.create_date DESC LIMIT 10
// 
$gw->noscope()->scope('active latest')->array();

// Closure 
$gw->scope('latest', 9)->array();
//  SELECT NOW(), t_table.* FROM t_table ORDER BY t_table.create_date DESC LIMIT 9

// 
$gw->scoping('id', ['invalid_flg' => 1], 'id DESC')->array();
//  SELECT id FROM t_table WHERE t_table.invalid_flg = 1 ORDER BY id DESC
// 
$gw->column('id')->where(['invalid_flg' => 1])->array();
//  SELECT id FROM t_table WHERE t_table.invalid_flg = 1

//  insert/update/delete 
$gw->scope('active')->update(['column' => 'data']);
//  UPDATE t_table SET column = 'data' WHERE t_table.delete_flg = 0

insert/update/delete where
insert/update/delete
insert/update/delete

insert/update/delete
delete_flg = 0 $gw->update(['delete_flg' => 1], ['primary_id' => 99])
delete_flg = 0
insert/update/delete noscope unscope

select
1

// 
$gw->scope('active');
$gw->array();
//  `SELECT * FROM table_name` 

// 
$gw = $gw->scope('active');
$gw->array();
//  `SELECT * FROM table_name WHERE table_name.delete_flg = 0` 

// 
$gw->scope('active')->array();

Traversable, Countable

Traversable Countable foreach count() 

// active  foreach 
foreach ($gw->scope('active') as $item) {
    var_dump($item);
}

// active 
$gw->count();

foreach array $defaultIteration
$defaultIteration

  • Database defaultIteration

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::setVirtualColumn()

setVirtualColumn(['fullname' => new Expression('CONCAT(sei, mei)')]);

* !ignore
defaultImplicitVirtual true *
'!' ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::column()
defaultImplicitVirtual Gateway

select, where, having
orderBy select having mysql select, where

JOIN

or or JOIN
end 

# 
$db->t_article->join('inner', $db->t_comment, [$oncond])->array();

#  JOIN 
// end() 
$db->t_article->t_comment->end()->array();
// end()  SELECT * FROM t_comment t_article  t_comment  JOIN  t_comment t_comment  t_comment  array() 
$db->t_article->t_comment->array();
// JOIN 
$db->t_article->t_comment->as('C')->scope('active')->orderBy('id')->end()->array();

#  JOIN 
//  end() 
$db->t_article->t_comment()->array();
//  t_user  t_article  JOIN 
$db->t_article->t_comment()->t_user()->array();
//  scoping 
$db->t_article->t_comment('id, comment', ['id' => 3])->array();

# invoke 
$db->t_article->t_comment['@active AS C']()->array();

JOIN $defaultJoinMethod
$defaultJoinMethod INNER, LEFT
"AUTO" AUTO JOIN INNER or LEFT
LEFT
AUTO NOT NULL NULL

columnJOIN

limit, groupBy, having JOIN where -> ON

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetGet()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::__toString()

// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE t_table.primary_id = '1'
echo $gw->pk(1);
// SELECT T.id, T.title FROM t_table T WHERE T.create_at = '2014-03-31' LIMIT 1
echo $gw->as('T')->column(['id', 'title'])->where(['create_at' => '2014-03-31'])->limit(1);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetExists()

$offset
$offset 

# 
$exists1 = isset($gw[1]);      // 1 true
$exists2 = isset($gw[[1, 2]]); // [1, 2] true

# 
$exists1 = isset($gw['article_title']);    // true
$exists2 = isset($gw['undefined_column']); // false

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetGet()

$offset where pk
$offset '' tuple
$offset value
$offset
[condition] [] 

#  pk (where) 
$row = $gw[1]->tuple();      // 1
$row = $gw[[1, 2]]->tuple(); // [1, 2]
$row = $gw->find($pk);       // 2

# 
$row = $gw['*'];
// WHERE 
$row = $gw->[1]['*'];  // =1 SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE id = 1
$row = $gw->[1]['**']; //  QueryBuilder::column() 

# 
$title = $gw['article_title'];
// WHERE 
$title = $gw->pk(1)['article_title'];
$title = $gw->scope('scopename')['article_title'];

# 
$gw = $gw['@scope1@scope2 AS GW'];
$gw = $gw->scope('scope1')->scope('scope2')->as('GW'); // 

# 
$gw['G.id']->array();
// SELECT G.id FROM t_table G

# [condition]  [] 
$gw = $gw['[id: 123]']; // 
$gw = $gw['id: 123'];   // [] [] 
$gw = $gw['id=123'];    // 
$gw = $gw->where(['id' => 123]); // 

# invoke 
$db->t_article->t_comment['@scope1@scope2 AS C']($column, $where);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetSet()

$offset null ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::insert()
$offset ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::modify()
$offset ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::update() 

# 1 insert
$gw[] = [$dataarray]; // $dataarray  insert 

# 1 modify
$gw[1] = [$dataarray];      // $gw->modify([$dataarray] + [pcol => 1])
$gw[[1, 2]] = [$dataarray]; // $gw->modify([$dataarray] + [pcol1 => 1, pcol2 => 2])

# 
$gw['article_title'] = '';
// WHERE 
$gw->scope('scopename')['article_title'] = '';
$gw['id: 1']['article_title'] = '';
$gw->pk(1)['article_title'] = '';
$gw[1]['article_title'] = '';

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetUnset()

$offset ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::delete() 

# 
unset($gw[1]);      // 1
unset($gw[[1, 2]]); // [1, 2]

$force true

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::end()

join

jQuery end() 

#  $select  t_child __get 
$select = $db->t_parent->t_child->select();

#  $select  t_parent end()  join 
$select = $db->t_parent->t_child->end()->select();

#  $select  t_child 1
$select = $db->t_parent->t_child->t_grand->end(1)->select();

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::modifier()

echo $gw->modifier();

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::join()

JOIN 


# joinOn  innerJoinOn 
$db->t_from->joinOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from INNER JOIN t_join ON hoge = fuga

# leftJoinOn  LEFT 
$db->t_from->leftJoinOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from LEFT JOIN t_join ON hoge = fuga

# joinForeign  autoJoinForeign  INNER  AUTO 
$db->t_from->joinForeign($db->t_join);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from INNER JOIN t_join ON t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col

# leftJoinForeign  LEFT 
$db->t_from->leftJoinForeign($db->t_join);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from LEFT JOIN t_join ON t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col

# joinForeignOn  autoJoinForeignOn  INNER  AUTO 
$db->t_from->joinForeignOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from INNER JOIN t_join ON (t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col) AND (hoge = fuga)

# leftJoinForeignOn  LEFT 
$db->t_from->leftJoinForeignOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from LEFT JOIN t_join ON (t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col) AND (hoge = fuga)

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::joinOn()

INNER join()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::innerJoinOn()

INNER join()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::leftJoinOn()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::joinForeign()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::innerJoinForeign()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::leftJoinForeign()

LEFT join()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::rightJoinForeign()

RIGHT join()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::joinForeignOn()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::innerJoinForeignOn()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::leftJoinForeignOn()
